00116 void osc_pack_req_body(struct ptlrpc_request *req, struct obdo *oa)
00117 {
00118         struct ost_body *body;
00119 
00120         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00121         LASSERT(body);
00122 
00123         lustre_set_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, &body->oa, oa);
00124 }
00125 
00126 static int osc_getattr(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00127                        struct obdo *oa)
00128 {
00129         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00130         struct ost_body         *body;
00131         int                      rc;
00132 
00133         ENTRY;
00134         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_OST_GETATTR);
00135         if (req == NULL)
00136                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00137 
00138         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_GETATTR);
00139         if (rc) {
00140                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00141                 RETURN(rc);
00142         }
00143 
00144         osc_pack_req_body(req, oa);
00145 
00146         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00147 
00148         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00149         if (rc)
00150                 GOTO(out, rc);
00151 
00152         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00153         if (body == NULL)
00154                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00155 
00156         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "mode: %o\n", body->oa.o_mode);
00157         lustre_get_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, oa, &body->oa);
00158 
00159         oa->o_blksize = cli_brw_size(exp->exp_obd);
00160         oa->o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLBLKSZ;
00161 
00162         EXIT;
00163 out:
00164         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00165 
00166         return rc;
00167 }

00169 static int osc_setattr(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00170                        struct obdo *oa)
00171 {
00172         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00173         struct ost_body         *body;
00174         int                      rc;
00175 
00176         ENTRY;
00177         LASSERT(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLGROUP);
00178 
00179         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_OST_SETATTR);
00180         if (req == NULL)
00181                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00182 
00183         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_SETATTR);
00184         if (rc) {
00185                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00186                 RETURN(rc);
00187         }
00188 
00189         osc_pack_req_body(req, oa);
00190 
00191         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00192 
00193         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00194         if (rc)
00195                 GOTO(out, rc);
00196 
00197         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00198         if (body == NULL)
00199                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00200 
00201         lustre_get_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, oa, &body->oa);
00202 
00203         EXIT;
00204 out:
00205         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00206 
00207         RETURN(rc);
00208 }

00210 static int osc_setattr_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00211                                  struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00212                                  struct osc_setattr_args *sa, int rc)
00213 {
00214         struct ost_body *body;
00215         ENTRY;
00216 
00217         if (rc != 0)
00218                 GOTO(out, rc);
00219 
00220         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00221         if (body == NULL)
00222                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00223 
00224         lustre_get_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, sa->sa_oa,
00225                              &body->oa);
00226 out:
00227         rc = sa->sa_upcall(sa->sa_cookie, rc);
00228         RETURN(rc);
00229 }
00230 
00231 int osc_setattr_async(struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa,
00232                       obd_enqueue_update_f upcall, void *cookie,
00233                       struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset)
00234 {
00235         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00236         struct osc_setattr_args *sa;
00237         int                      rc;
00238 
00239         ENTRY;
00240 
00241         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_OST_SETATTR);
00242         if (req == NULL)
00243                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00244 
00245         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_SETATTR);
00246         if (rc) {
00247                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00248                 RETURN(rc);
00249         }
00250 
00251         osc_pack_req_body(req, oa);
00252 
00253         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00254 
00255         /* do mds to ost setattr asynchronously */
00256         if (!rqset) {
00257                 /* Do not wait for response. */
00258                 ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00259         } else {
00260                 req->rq_interpret_reply =
00261                         (ptlrpc_interpterer_t)osc_setattr_interpret;
00262 
00263                 CLASSERT(sizeof(*sa) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
00264                 sa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00265                 sa->sa_oa = oa;
00266                 sa->sa_upcall = upcall;
00267                 sa->sa_cookie = cookie;
00268 
00269                 if (rqset == PTLRPCD_SET)
00270                         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00271                 else
00272                         ptlrpc_set_add_req(rqset, req);
00273         }
00274 
00275         RETURN(0);
00276 }

00278 static int osc_ladvise_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00279                                  struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00280                                  void *arg, int rc)
00281 {
00282         struct osc_ladvise_args *la = arg;
00283         struct ost_body *body;
00284         ENTRY;
00285 
00286         if (rc != 0)
00287                 GOTO(out, rc);
00288 
00289         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00290         if (body == NULL)
00291                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00292 
00293         *la->la_oa = body->oa;
00294 out:
00295         rc = la->la_upcall(la->la_cookie, rc);
00296         RETURN(rc);
00297 }
00298 
00303 int osc_ladvise_base(struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa,
00304                      struct ladvise_hdr *ladvise_hdr,
00305                      obd_enqueue_update_f upcall, void *cookie,
00306                      struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset)
00307 {
00308         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00309         struct ost_body         *body;
00310         struct osc_ladvise_args *la;
00311         int                      rc;
00312         struct lu_ladvise       *req_ladvise;
00313         struct lu_ladvise       *ladvise = ladvise_hdr->lah_advise;
00314         int                      num_advise = ladvise_hdr->lah_count;
00315         struct ladvise_hdr      *req_ladvise_hdr;
00316         ENTRY;
00317 
00318         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_OST_LADVISE);
00319         if (req == NULL)
00320                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00321 
00322         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_LADVISE, RCL_CLIENT,
00323                              num_advise * sizeof(*ladvise));
00324         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_LADVISE);
00325         if (rc != 0) {
00326                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00327                 RETURN(rc);
00328         }
00329         req->rq_request_portal = OST_IO_PORTAL;
00330         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
00331 
00332         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00333         LASSERT(body);
00334         lustre_set_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, &body->oa,
00335                              oa);
00336 
00337         req_ladvise_hdr = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill,
00338                                                  &RMF_OST_LADVISE_HDR);
00339         memcpy(req_ladvise_hdr, ladvise_hdr, sizeof(*ladvise_hdr));
00340 
00341         req_ladvise = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_LADVISE);
00342         memcpy(req_ladvise, ladvise, sizeof(*ladvise) * num_advise);
00343         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00344 
00345         if (rqset == NULL) {
00346                 /* Do not wait for response. */
00347                 ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00348                 RETURN(0);
00349         }
00350 
00351         req->rq_interpret_reply = osc_ladvise_interpret;
00352         CLASSERT(sizeof(*la) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
00353         la = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00354         la->la_oa = oa;
00355         la->la_upcall = upcall;
00356         la->la_cookie = cookie;
00357 
00358         if (rqset == PTLRPCD_SET)
00359                 ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00360         else
00361                 ptlrpc_set_add_req(rqset, req);
00362 
00363         RETURN(0);
00364 }
00365 
00366 static int osc_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00367                       struct obdo *oa)
00368 {
00369         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00370         struct ost_body       *body;
00371         int                    rc;
00372         ENTRY;
00373 
00374         LASSERT(oa != NULL);
00375         LASSERT(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLGROUP);
00376         LASSERT(fid_seq_is_echo(ostid_seq(&oa->o_oi)));
00377 
00378         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_OST_CREATE);
00379         if (req == NULL)
00380                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00381 
00382         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_CREATE);
00383         if (rc) {
00384                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00385                 GOTO(out, rc);
00386         }
00387 
00388         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00389         LASSERT(body);
00390 
00391         lustre_set_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, &body->oa, oa);
00392 
00393         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00394 
00395         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00396         if (rc)
00397                 GOTO(out_req, rc);
00398 
00399         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00400         if (body == NULL)
00401                 GOTO(out_req, rc = -EPROTO);
00402 
00403         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "oa flags %x\n", oa->o_flags);
00404         lustre_get_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, oa, &body->oa);
00405 
00406         oa->o_blksize = cli_brw_size(exp->exp_obd);
00407         oa->o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLBLKSZ;
00408 
00409         CDEBUG(D_HA, "transno: "LPD64"\n",
00410                lustre_msg_get_transno(req->rq_repmsg));
00411 out_req:
00412         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00413 out:
00414         RETURN(rc);
00415 }
00416 
00417 int osc_punch_base(struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa,
00418                    obd_enqueue_update_f upcall, void *cookie,
00419                    struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset)
00420 {
00421         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00422         struct osc_setattr_args *sa;
00423         struct ost_body         *body;
00424         int                      rc;
00425         ENTRY;
00426 
00427         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_OST_PUNCH);
00428         if (req == NULL)
00429                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00430 
00431         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_PUNCH);
00432         if (rc) {
00433                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00434                 RETURN(rc);
00435         }
00436         req->rq_request_portal = OST_IO_PORTAL; /* bug 7198 */
00437         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
00438 
00439         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00440         LASSERT(body);
00441         lustre_set_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, &body->oa, oa);
00442 
00443         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00444 
00445         req->rq_interpret_reply = (ptlrpc_interpterer_t)osc_setattr_interpret;
00446         CLASSERT(sizeof(*sa) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
00447         sa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00448         sa->sa_oa = oa;
00449         sa->sa_upcall = upcall;
00450         sa->sa_cookie = cookie;
00451         if (rqset == PTLRPCD_SET)
00452                 ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00453         else
00454                 ptlrpc_set_add_req(rqset, req);
00455 
00456         RETURN(0);
00457 }
00458 
00459 static int osc_sync_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00460                               struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00461                               void *arg, int rc)
00462 {
00463         struct osc_fsync_args   *fa = arg;
00464         struct ost_body         *body;
00465         struct cl_attr          *attr = &osc_env_info(env)->oti_attr;
00466         unsigned long           valid = 0;
00467         struct cl_object        *obj;
00468         ENTRY;
00469 
00470         if (rc != 0)
00471                 GOTO(out, rc);
00472 
00473         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00474         if (body == NULL) {
00475                 CERROR("can't unpack ost_body\n");
00476                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
00477         }
00478 
00479         *fa->fa_oa = body->oa;
00480         obj = osc2cl(fa->fa_obj);
00481 
00482         /* Update osc object's blocks attribute */
00483         cl_object_attr_lock(obj);
00484         if (body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS) {
00485                 attr->cat_blocks = body->oa.o_blocks;
00486                 valid |= CAT_BLOCKS;
00487         }
00488 
00489         if (valid != 0)
00490                 cl_object_attr_update(env, obj, attr, valid);
00491         cl_object_attr_unlock(obj);
00492 
00493 out:
00494         rc = fa->fa_upcall(fa->fa_cookie, rc);
00495         RETURN(rc);
00496 }
00497 
00498 int osc_sync_base(struct osc_object *obj, struct obdo *oa,
00499                   obd_enqueue_update_f upcall, void *cookie,
00500                   struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset)
00501 {
00502         struct obd_export     *exp = osc_export(obj);
00503         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00504         struct ost_body       *body;
00505         struct osc_fsync_args *fa;
00506         int                    rc;
00507         ENTRY;
00508 
00509         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_OST_SYNC);
00510         if (req == NULL)
00511                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00512 
00513         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_SYNC);
00514         if (rc) {
00515                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00516                 RETURN(rc);
00517         }
00518 
00519         /* overload the size and blocks fields in the oa with start/end */
00520         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00521         LASSERT(body);
00522         lustre_set_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, &body->oa, oa);
00523 
00524         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00525         req->rq_interpret_reply = osc_sync_interpret;
00526 
00527         CLASSERT(sizeof(*fa) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
00528         fa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
00529         fa->fa_obj = obj;
00530         fa->fa_oa = oa;
00531         fa->fa_upcall = upcall;
00532         fa->fa_cookie = cookie;
00533 
00534         if (rqset == PTLRPCD_SET)
00535                 ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00536         else
00537                 ptlrpc_set_add_req(rqset, req);
00538 
00539         RETURN (0);
00540 }
00541 
00542 /* Find and cancel locally locks matched by @mode in the resource found by
00543  * @objid. Found locks are added into @cancel list. Returns the amount of
00544  * locks added to @cancels list. */
00545 static int osc_resource_get_unused(struct obd_export *exp, struct obdo *oa,
00546                                    struct list_head *cancels,
00547                                    enum ldlm_mode mode, __u64 lock_flags)
00548 {
00549         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = exp->exp_obd->obd_namespace;
00550         struct ldlm_res_id res_id;
00551         struct ldlm_resource *res;
00552         int count;
00553         ENTRY;
00554 
00555         /* Return, i.e. cancel nothing, only if ELC is supported (flag in
00556          * export) but disabled through procfs (flag in NS).
00557          *
00558          * This distinguishes from a case when ELC is not supported originally,
00559          * when we still want to cancel locks in advance and just cancel them
00560          * locally, without sending any RPC. */
00561         if (exp_connect_cancelset(exp) && !ns_connect_cancelset(ns))
00562                 RETURN(0);
00563 
00564         ostid_build_res_name(&oa->o_oi, &res_id);
00565         res = ldlm_resource_get(ns, NULL, &res_id, 0, 0);
00566         if (IS_ERR(res))
00567                 RETURN(0);
00568 
00569         LDLM_RESOURCE_ADDREF(res);
00570         count = ldlm_cancel_resource_local(res, cancels, NULL, mode,
00571                                            lock_flags, 0, NULL);
00572         LDLM_RESOURCE_DELREF(res);
00573         ldlm_resource_putref(res);
00574         RETURN(count);
00575 }
00576 
00577 static int osc_destroy_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00578                                  struct ptlrpc_request *req, void *data,
00579                                  int rc)
00580 {
00581         struct client_obd *cli = &req->rq_import->imp_obd->u.cli;
00582 
00583         atomic_dec(&cli->cl_destroy_in_flight);
00584         wake_up(&cli->cl_destroy_waitq);
00585         return 0;
00586 }
00587 
00588 static int osc_can_send_destroy(struct client_obd *cli)
00589 {
00590         if (atomic_inc_return(&cli->cl_destroy_in_flight) <=
00591             cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight) {
00592                 /* The destroy request can be sent */
00593                 return 1;
00594         }
00595         if (atomic_dec_return(&cli->cl_destroy_in_flight) <
00596             cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight) {
00597                 /*
00598                  * The counter has been modified between the two atomic
00599                  * operations.
00600                  */
00601                 wake_up(&cli->cl_destroy_waitq);
00602         }
00603         return 0;
00604 }
00605 
00606 static int osc_destroy(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00607                        struct obdo *oa)
00608 {
00609         struct client_obd     *cli = &exp->exp_obd->u.cli;
00610         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00611         struct ost_body       *body;
00612         struct list_head       cancels = LIST_HEAD_INIT(cancels);
00613         int rc, count;
00614         ENTRY;
00615 
00616         if (!oa) {
00617                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "oa NULL\n");
00618                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00619         }
00620 
00621         count = osc_resource_get_unused(exp, oa, &cancels, LCK_PW,
00622                                         LDLM_FL_DISCARD_DATA);
00623 
00624         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_OST_DESTROY);
00625         if (req == NULL) {
00626                 ldlm_lock_list_put(&cancels, l_bl_ast, count);
00627                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00628         }
00629 
00630         rc = ldlm_prep_elc_req(exp, req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_DESTROY,
00631                                0, &cancels, count);
00632         if (rc) {
00633                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00634                 RETURN(rc);
00635         }
00636 
00637         req->rq_request_portal = OST_IO_PORTAL; /* bug 7198 */
00638         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
00639 
00640         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00641         LASSERT(body);
00642         lustre_set_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, &body->oa, oa);
00643 
00644         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00645 
00646         req->rq_interpret_reply = osc_destroy_interpret;
00647         if (!osc_can_send_destroy(cli)) {
00648                 struct l_wait_info lwi = LWI_INTR(LWI_ON_SIGNAL_NOOP, NULL);
00649 
00650                 /*
00651                  * Wait until the number of on-going destroy RPCs drops
00652                  * under max_rpc_in_flight
00653                  */
00654                 l_wait_event_exclusive(cli->cl_destroy_waitq,
00655                                        osc_can_send_destroy(cli), &lwi);
00656         }
00657 
00658         /* Do not wait for response */
00659         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
00660         RETURN(0);
00661 }
00662 
00663 static void osc_announce_cached(struct client_obd *cli, struct obdo *oa,
00664                                 long writing_bytes)
00665 {
00666         u64 bits = OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS | OBD_MD_FLGRANT;
00667 
00668         LASSERT(!(oa->o_valid & bits));
00669 
00670         oa->o_valid |= bits;
00671         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00672         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(&cli->cl_import->imp_connect_data, GRANT_PARAM))
00673                 oa->o_dirty = cli->cl_dirty_grant;
00674         else
00675                 oa->o_dirty = cli->cl_dirty_pages << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00676         if (unlikely(cli->cl_dirty_pages - cli->cl_dirty_transit >
00677                      cli->cl_dirty_max_pages)) {
00678                 CERROR("dirty %lu - %lu > dirty_max %lu\n",
00679                        cli->cl_dirty_pages, cli->cl_dirty_transit,
00680                        cli->cl_dirty_max_pages);
00681                 oa->o_undirty = 0;
00682         } else if (unlikely(atomic_long_read(&obd_dirty_pages) -
00683                             atomic_long_read(&obd_dirty_transit_pages) >
00684                             (long)(obd_max_dirty_pages + 1))) {
00685                 /* The atomic_read() allowing the atomic_inc() are
00686                  * not covered by a lock thus they may safely race and trip
00687                  * this CERROR() unless we add in a small fudge factor (+1). */
00688                 CERROR("%s: dirty %ld - %ld > system dirty_max %ld\n",
00689                        cli_name(cli), atomic_long_read(&obd_dirty_pages),
00690                        atomic_long_read(&obd_dirty_transit_pages),
00691                        obd_max_dirty_pages);
00692                 oa->o_undirty = 0;
00693         } else if (unlikely(cli->cl_dirty_max_pages - cli->cl_dirty_pages >
00694                             0x7fffffff)) {
00695                 CERROR("dirty %lu - dirty_max %lu too big???\n",
00696                        cli->cl_dirty_pages, cli->cl_dirty_max_pages);
00697                 oa->o_undirty = 0;
00698         } else {
00699                 unsigned long nrpages;
00700 
00701                 nrpages = cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc;
00702                 nrpages *= cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight + 1;
00703                 nrpages = max(nrpages, cli->cl_dirty_max_pages);
00704                 oa->o_undirty = nrpages << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00705                 if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(&cli->cl_import->imp_connect_data,
00706                                  GRANT_PARAM)) {
00707                         int nrextents;
00708 
00709                         /* take extent tax into account when asking for more
00710                          * grant space */
00711                         nrextents = (nrpages + cli->cl_max_extent_pages - 1)  /
00712                                      cli->cl_max_extent_pages;
00713                         oa->o_undirty += nrextents * cli->cl_grant_extent_tax;
00714                 }
00715         }
00716         oa->o_grant = cli->cl_avail_grant + cli->cl_reserved_grant;
00717         oa->o_dropped = cli->cl_lost_grant;
00718         cli->cl_lost_grant = 0;
00719         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00720         CDEBUG(D_CACHE,"dirty: "LPU64" undirty: %u dropped %u grant: "LPU64"\n",
00721                oa->o_dirty, oa->o_undirty, oa->o_dropped, oa->o_grant);
00722 }
00723 
00724 void osc_update_next_shrink(struct client_obd *cli)
00725 {
00726         cli->cl_next_shrink_grant =
00727                 cfs_time_shift(cli->cl_grant_shrink_interval);
00728         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "next time %ld to shrink grant \n",
00729                cli->cl_next_shrink_grant);
00730 }
00731 
00732 static void __osc_update_grant(struct client_obd *cli, u64 grant)
00733 {
00734         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00735         cli->cl_avail_grant += grant;
00736         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00737 }
00738 
00739 static void osc_update_grant(struct client_obd *cli, struct ost_body *body)
00740 {
00741         if (body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLGRANT) {
00742                 CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "got "LPU64" extra grant\n", body->oa.o_grant);
00743                 __osc_update_grant(cli, body->oa.o_grant);
00744         }
00745 }
00746 
00747 static int osc_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
00748                               u32 keylen, void *key,
00749                               u32 vallen, void *val,
00750                               struct ptlrpc_request_set *set);
00751 
00752 static int osc_shrink_grant_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00753                                       struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00754                                       void *aa, int rc)
00755 {
00756         struct client_obd *cli = &req->rq_import->imp_obd->u.cli;
00757         struct obdo *oa = ((struct osc_grant_args *)aa)->aa_oa;
00758         struct ost_body *body;
00759 
00760         if (rc != 0) {
00761                 __osc_update_grant(cli, oa->o_grant);
00762                 GOTO(out, rc);
00763         }
00764 
00765         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
00766         LASSERT(body);
00767         osc_update_grant(cli, body);
00768 out:
00769         OBDO_FREE(oa);
00770         return rc;
00771 }
00772 
00773 static void osc_shrink_grant_local(struct client_obd *cli, struct obdo *oa)
00774 {
00775         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00776         oa->o_grant = cli->cl_avail_grant / 4;
00777         cli->cl_avail_grant -= oa->o_grant;
00778         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00779         if (!(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS)) {
00780                 oa->o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLFLAGS;
00781                 oa->o_flags = 0;
00782         }
00783         oa->o_flags |= OBD_FL_SHRINK_GRANT;
00784         osc_update_next_shrink(cli);
00785 }
00786 
00787 /* Shrink the current grant, either from some large amount to enough for a
00788  * full set of in-flight RPCs, or if we have already shrunk to that limit
00789  * then to enough for a single RPC.  This avoids keeping more grant than
00790  * needed, and avoids shrinking the grant piecemeal. */
00791 static int osc_shrink_grant(struct client_obd *cli)
00792 {
00793         __u64 target_bytes = (cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight + 1) *
00794                              (cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00795 
00796         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00797         if (cli->cl_avail_grant <= target_bytes)
00798                 target_bytes = cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00799         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00800 
00801         return osc_shrink_grant_to_target(cli, target_bytes);
00802 }
00803 
00804 int osc_shrink_grant_to_target(struct client_obd *cli, __u64 target_bytes)
00805 {
00806         int                     rc = 0;
00807         struct ost_body        *body;
00808         ENTRY;
00809 
00810         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00811         /* Don't shrink if we are already above or below the desired limit
00812          * We don't want to shrink below a single RPC, as that will negatively
00813          * impact block allocation and long-term performance. */
00814         if (target_bytes < cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT)
00815                 target_bytes = cli->cl_max_pages_per_rpc << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00816 
00817         if (target_bytes >= cli->cl_avail_grant) {
00818                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00819                 RETURN(0);
00820         }
00821         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00822 
00823         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(body);
00824         if (!body)
00825                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00826 
00827         osc_announce_cached(cli, &body->oa, 0);
00828 
00829         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00830         body->oa.o_grant = cli->cl_avail_grant - target_bytes;
00831         cli->cl_avail_grant = target_bytes;
00832         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00833         if (!(body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS)) {
00834                 body->oa.o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLFLAGS;
00835                 body->oa.o_flags = 0;
00836         }
00837         body->oa.o_flags |= OBD_FL_SHRINK_GRANT;
00838         osc_update_next_shrink(cli);
00839 
00840         rc = osc_set_info_async(NULL, cli->cl_import->imp_obd->obd_self_export,
00841                                 sizeof(KEY_GRANT_SHRINK), KEY_GRANT_SHRINK,
00842                                 sizeof(*body), body, NULL);
00843         if (rc != 0)
00844                 __osc_update_grant(cli, body->oa.o_grant);
00845         OBD_FREE_PTR(body);
00846         RETURN(rc);
00847 }
00848 
00849 static int osc_should_shrink_grant(struct client_obd *client)
00850 {
00851         cfs_time_t time = cfs_time_current();
00852         cfs_time_t next_shrink = client->cl_next_shrink_grant;
00853 
00854         if ((client->cl_import->imp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags &
00855              OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_SHRINK) == 0)
00856                 return 0;
00857 
00858         if (cfs_time_aftereq(time, next_shrink - 5 * CFS_TICK)) {
00859                 /* Get the current RPC size directly, instead of going via:
00860                  * cli_brw_size(obd->u.cli.cl_import->imp_obd->obd_self_export)
00861                  * Keep comment here so that it can be found by searching. */
00862                 int brw_size = client->cl_max_pages_per_rpc << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00863 
00864                 if (client->cl_import->imp_state == LUSTRE_IMP_FULL &&
00865                     client->cl_avail_grant > brw_size)
00866                         return 1;
00867                 else
00868                         osc_update_next_shrink(client);
00869         }
00870         return 0;
00871 }
00872 
00873 static int osc_grant_shrink_grant_cb(struct timeout_item *item, void *data)
00874 {
00875         struct client_obd *client;
00876 
00877         list_for_each_entry(client, &item->ti_obd_list, cl_grant_shrink_list) {
00878                 if (osc_should_shrink_grant(client))
00879                         osc_shrink_grant(client);
00880         }
00881         return 0;
00882 }
00883 
00884 static int osc_add_shrink_grant(struct client_obd *client)
00885 {
00886         int rc;
00887 
00888         rc = ptlrpc_add_timeout_client(client->cl_grant_shrink_interval,
00889                                        TIMEOUT_GRANT,
00890                                        osc_grant_shrink_grant_cb, NULL,
00891                                        &client->cl_grant_shrink_list);
00892         if (rc) {
00893                 CERROR("add grant client %s error %d\n", cli_name(client), rc);
00894                 return rc;
00895         }
00896         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "add grant client %s\n", cli_name(client));
00897         osc_update_next_shrink(client);
00898         return 0;
00899 }
00900 
00901 static int osc_del_shrink_grant(struct client_obd *client)
00902 {
00903         return ptlrpc_del_timeout_client(&client->cl_grant_shrink_list,
00904                                          TIMEOUT_GRANT);
00905 }
00906 
00907 static void osc_init_grant(struct client_obd *cli, struct obd_connect_data *ocd)
00908 {
00909         /*
00910          * ocd_grant is the total grant amount we're expect to hold: if we've
00911          * been evicted, it's the new avail_grant amount, cl_dirty_pages will
00912          * drop to 0 as inflight RPCs fail out; otherwise, it's avail_grant +
00913          * dirty.
00914          *
00915          * race is tolerable here: if we're evicted, but imp_state already
00916          * left EVICTED state, then cl_dirty_pages must be 0 already.
00917          */
00918         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00919         cli->cl_avail_grant = ocd->ocd_grant;
00920         if (cli->cl_import->imp_state != LUSTRE_IMP_EVICTED) {
00921                 cli->cl_avail_grant -= cli->cl_reserved_grant;
00922                 if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(ocd, GRANT_PARAM))
00923                         cli->cl_avail_grant -= cli->cl_dirty_grant;
00924                 else
00925                         cli->cl_avail_grant -=
00926                                         cli->cl_dirty_pages << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00927         }
00928 
00929         if (cli->cl_avail_grant < 0) {
00930                 CWARN("%s: available grant < 0: avail/ocd/dirty %ld/%u/%ld\n",
00931                       cli_name(cli), cli->cl_avail_grant,
00932                       ocd->ocd_grant, cli->cl_dirty_pages << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT);
00933                 /* workaround for servers which do not have the patch from
00934                  * LU-2679 */
00935                 cli->cl_avail_grant = ocd->ocd_grant;
00936         }
00937 
00938         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(ocd, GRANT_PARAM)) {
00939                 u64 size;
00940 
00941                 /* overhead for each extent insertion */
00942                 cli->cl_grant_extent_tax = ocd->ocd_grant_tax_kb << 10;
00943                 /* determine the appropriate chunk size used by osc_extent. */
00944                 cli->cl_chunkbits = max_t(int, PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT,
00945                                           ocd->ocd_grant_blkbits);
00946                 /* determine maximum extent size, in #pages */
00947                 size = (u64)ocd->ocd_grant_max_blks << ocd->ocd_grant_blkbits;
00948                 cli->cl_max_extent_pages = size >> PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00949                 if (cli->cl_max_extent_pages == 0)
00950                         cli->cl_max_extent_pages = 1;
00951         } else {
00952                 cli->cl_grant_extent_tax = 0;
00953                 cli->cl_chunkbits = PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
00954                 cli->cl_max_extent_pages = DT_MAX_BRW_PAGES;
00955         }
00956         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
00957 
00958         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "%s, setting cl_avail_grant: %ld cl_lost_grant: %ld."
00959                 "chunk bits: %d cl_max_extent_pages: %d\n",
00960                 cli_name(cli),
00961                 cli->cl_avail_grant, cli->cl_lost_grant, cli->cl_chunkbits,
00962                 cli->cl_max_extent_pages);
00963 
00964         if (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_SHRINK &&
00965             list_empty(&cli->cl_grant_shrink_list))
00966                 osc_add_shrink_grant(cli);
00967 }
00968 
00969 /* We assume that the reason this OSC got a short read is because it read
00970  * beyond the end of a stripe file; i.e. lustre is reading a sparse file
00971  * via the LOV, and it _knows_ it's reading inside the file, it's just that
00972  * this stripe never got written at or beyond this stripe offset yet. */
00973 static void handle_short_read(int nob_read, size_t page_count,
00974                               struct brw_page **pga)
00975 {
00976         char *ptr;
00977         int i = 0;
00978 
00979         /* skip bytes read OK */
00980         while (nob_read > 0) {
00981                 LASSERT (page_count > 0);
00982 
00983                 if (pga[i]->count > nob_read) {
00984                         /* EOF inside this page */
00985                         ptr = kmap(pga[i]->pg) +
00986                                 (pga[i]->off & ~PAGE_MASK);
00987                         memset(ptr + nob_read, 0, pga[i]->count - nob_read);
00988                         kunmap(pga[i]->pg);
00989                         page_count--;
00990                         i++;
00991                         break;
00992                 }
00993 
00994                 nob_read -= pga[i]->count;
00995                 page_count--;
00996                 i++;
00997         }
00998 
00999         /* zero remaining pages */
01000         while (page_count-- > 0) {
01001                 ptr = kmap(pga[i]->pg) + (pga[i]->off & ~PAGE_MASK);
01002                 memset(ptr, 0, pga[i]->count);
01003                 kunmap(pga[i]->pg);
01004                 i++;
01005         }
01006 }
01007 
01008 static int check_write_rcs(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01009                            int requested_nob, int niocount,
01010                            size_t page_count, struct brw_page **pga)
01011 {
01012         int     i;
01013         __u32   *remote_rcs;
01014 
01015         remote_rcs = req_capsule_server_sized_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_RCS,
01016                                                   sizeof(*remote_rcs) *
01017                                                   niocount);
01018         if (remote_rcs == NULL) {
01019                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Missing/short RC vector on BRW_WRITE reply\n");
01020                 return(-EPROTO);
01021         }
01022 
01023         /* return error if any niobuf was in error */
01024         for (i = 0; i < niocount; i++) {
01025                 if ((int)remote_rcs[i] < 0)
01026                         return(remote_rcs[i]);
01027 
01028                 if (remote_rcs[i] != 0) {
01029                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "rc[%d] invalid (%d) req %p\n",
01030                                 i, remote_rcs[i], req);
01031                         return(-EPROTO);
01032                 }
01033         }
01034 
01035         if (req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred != requested_nob) {
01036                 CERROR("Unexpected # bytes transferred: %d (requested %d)\n",
01037                        req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred, requested_nob);
01038                 return(-EPROTO);
01039         }
01040 
01041         return (0);
01042 }
01043 
01044 static inline int can_merge_pages(struct brw_page *p1, struct brw_page *p2)
01045 {
01046         if (p1->flag != p2->flag) {
01047                 unsigned mask = ~(OBD_BRW_FROM_GRANT | OBD_BRW_NOCACHE |
01048                                   OBD_BRW_SYNC       | OBD_BRW_ASYNC   |
01049                                   OBD_BRW_NOQUOTA    | OBD_BRW_SOFT_SYNC);
01050 
01051                 /* warn if we try to combine flags that we don't know to be
01052                  * safe to combine */
01053                 if (unlikely((p1->flag & mask) != (p2->flag & mask))) {
01054                         CWARN("Saw flags 0x%x and 0x%x in the same brw, please "
01055                               "report this at https://jira.hpdd.intel.com/\n",
01056                               p1->flag, p2->flag);
01057                 }
01058                 return 0;
01059         }
01060 
01061         return (p1->off + p1->count == p2->off);
01062 }
01063 
01064 static u32 osc_checksum_bulk(int nob, size_t pg_count,
01065                              struct brw_page **pga, int opc,
01066                              cksum_type_t cksum_type)
01067 {
01068         u32                             cksum;
01069         int                             i = 0;
01070         struct cfs_crypto_hash_desc     *hdesc;
01071         unsigned int                    bufsize;
01072         int                             err;
01073         unsigned char                   cfs_alg = cksum_obd2cfs(cksum_type);
01074 
01075         LASSERT(pg_count > 0);
01076 
01077         hdesc = cfs_crypto_hash_init(cfs_alg, NULL, 0);
01078         if (IS_ERR(hdesc)) {
01079                 CERROR("Unable to initialize checksum hash %s\n",
01080                        cfs_crypto_hash_name(cfs_alg));
01081                 return PTR_ERR(hdesc);
01082         }
01083 
01084         while (nob > 0 && pg_count > 0) {
01085                 unsigned int count = pga[i]->count > nob ? nob : pga[i]->count;
01086 
01087                 /* corrupt the data before we compute the checksum, to
01088                  * simulate an OST->client data error */
01089                 if (i == 0 && opc == OST_READ &&
01090                     OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CHECKSUM_RECEIVE)) {
01091                         unsigned char *ptr = kmap(pga[i]->pg);
01092                         int off = pga[i]->off & ~PAGE_MASK;
01093 
01094                         memcpy(ptr + off, "bad1", min_t(typeof(nob), 4, nob));
01095                         kunmap(pga[i]->pg);
01096                 }
01097                 cfs_crypto_hash_update_page(hdesc, pga[i]->pg,
01098                                             pga[i]->off & ~PAGE_MASK,
01099                                             count);
01100                 LL_CDEBUG_PAGE(D_PAGE, pga[i]->pg, "off %d\n",
01101                                (int)(pga[i]->off & ~PAGE_MASK));
01102 
01103                 nob -= pga[i]->count;
01104                 pg_count--;
01105                 i++;
01106         }
01107 
01108         bufsize = sizeof(cksum);
01109         err = cfs_crypto_hash_final(hdesc, (unsigned char *)&cksum, &bufsize);
01110 
01111         /* For sending we only compute the wrong checksum instead
01112          * of corrupting the data so it is still correct on a redo */
01113         if (opc == OST_WRITE && OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CHECKSUM_SEND))
01114                 cksum++;
01115 
01116         return cksum;
01117 }
01118 
01119 static int
01120 osc_brw_prep_request(int cmd, struct client_obd *cli, struct obdo *oa,
01121                      u32 page_count, struct brw_page **pga,
01122                      struct ptlrpc_request **reqp, int resend)
01123 {
01124         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01125         struct ptlrpc_bulk_desc *desc;
01126         struct ost_body         *body;
01127         struct obd_ioobj        *ioobj;
01128         struct niobuf_remote    *niobuf;
01129         int niocount, i, requested_nob, opc, rc;
01130         struct osc_brw_async_args *aa;
01131         struct req_capsule      *pill;
01132         struct brw_page *pg_prev;
01133 
01134         ENTRY;
01135         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_BRW_PREP_REQ))
01136                 RETURN(-ENOMEM); /* Recoverable */
01137         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_BRW_PREP_REQ2))
01138                 RETURN(-EINVAL); /* Fatal */
01139 
01140         if ((cmd & OBD_BRW_WRITE) != 0) {
01141                 opc = OST_WRITE;
01142                 req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pool(cli->cl_import,
01143                                                 osc_rq_pool,
01144                                                 &RQF_OST_BRW_WRITE);
01145         } else {
01146                 opc = OST_READ;
01147                 req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(cli->cl_import, &RQF_OST_BRW_READ);
01148         }
01149         if (req == NULL)
01150                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01151 
01152         for (niocount = i = 1; i < page_count; i++) {
01153                 if (!can_merge_pages(pga[i - 1], pga[i]))
01154                         niocount++;
01155         }
01156 
01157         pill = &req->rq_pill;
01158         req_capsule_set_size(pill, &RMF_OBD_IOOBJ, RCL_CLIENT,
01159                              sizeof(*ioobj));
01160         req_capsule_set_size(pill, &RMF_NIOBUF_REMOTE, RCL_CLIENT,
01161                              niocount * sizeof(*niobuf));
01162 
01163         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, opc);
01164         if (rc) {
01165                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01166                 RETURN(rc);
01167         }
01168         req->rq_request_portal = OST_IO_PORTAL; /* bug 7198 */
01169         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
01170         /* ask ptlrpc not to resend on EINPROGRESS since BRWs have their own
01171          * retry logic */
01172         req->rq_no_retry_einprogress = 1;
01173 
01174         desc = ptlrpc_prep_bulk_imp(req, page_count,
01175                 cli->cl_import->imp_connect_data.ocd_brw_size >> LNET_MTU_BITS,
01176                 (opc == OST_WRITE ? PTLRPC_BULK_GET_SOURCE :
01177                         PTLRPC_BULK_PUT_SINK) |
01178                         PTLRPC_BULK_BUF_KIOV,
01179                 OST_BULK_PORTAL,
01180                 &ptlrpc_bulk_kiov_pin_ops);
01181 
01182         if (desc == NULL)
01183                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01184         /* NB request now owns desc and will free it when it gets freed */
01185 
01186         body = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
01187         ioobj = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_OBD_IOOBJ);
01188         niobuf = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_NIOBUF_REMOTE);
01189         LASSERT(body != NULL && ioobj != NULL && niobuf != NULL);
01190 
01191         lustre_set_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data, &body->oa, oa);
01192 
01193         obdo_to_ioobj(oa, ioobj);
01194         ioobj->ioo_bufcnt = niocount;
01195         /* The high bits of ioo_max_brw tells server _maximum_ number of bulks
01196          * that might be send for this request.  The actual number is decided
01197          * when the RPC is finally sent in ptlrpc_register_bulk(). It sends
01198          * "max - 1" for old client compatibility sending "0", and also so the
01199          * the actual maximum is a power-of-two number, not one less. LU-1431 */
01200         ioobj_max_brw_set(ioobj, desc->bd_md_max_brw);
01201         LASSERT(page_count > 0);
01202         pg_prev = pga[0];
01203         for (requested_nob = i = 0; i < page_count; i++, niobuf++) {
01204                 struct brw_page *pg = pga[i];
01205                 int poff = pg->off & ~PAGE_MASK;
01206 
01207                 LASSERT(pg->count > 0);
01208                 /* make sure there is no gap in the middle of page array */
01209                 LASSERTF(page_count == 1 ||
01210                          (ergo(i == 0, poff + pg->count == PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) &&
01211                           ergo(i > 0 && i < page_count - 1,
01212                                poff == 0 && pg->count == PAGE_CACHE_SIZE)   &&
01213                           ergo(i == page_count - 1, poff == 0)),
01214                          "i: %d/%d pg: %p off: "LPU64", count: %u\n",
01215                          i, page_count, pg, pg->off, pg->count);
01216                 LASSERTF(i == 0 || pg->off > pg_prev->off,
01217                          "i %d p_c %u pg %p [pri %lu ind %lu] off "LPU64
01218                          " prev_pg %p [pri %lu ind %lu] off "LPU64"\n",
01219                          i, page_count,
01220                          pg->pg, page_private(pg->pg), pg->pg->index, pg->off,
01221                          pg_prev->pg, page_private(pg_prev->pg),
01222                          pg_prev->pg->index, pg_prev->off);
01223                 LASSERT((pga[0]->flag & OBD_BRW_SRVLOCK) ==
01224                         (pg->flag & OBD_BRW_SRVLOCK));
01225 
01226                 desc->bd_frag_ops->add_kiov_frag(desc, pg->pg, poff, pg->count);
01227                 requested_nob += pg->count;
01228 
01229                 if (i > 0 && can_merge_pages(pg_prev, pg)) {
01230                         niobuf--;
01231                         niobuf->rnb_len += pg->count;
01232                 } else {
01233                         niobuf->rnb_offset = pg->off;
01234                         niobuf->rnb_len    = pg->count;
01235                         niobuf->rnb_flags  = pg->flag;
01236                 }
01237                 pg_prev = pg;
01238         }
01239 
01240         LASSERTF((void *)(niobuf - niocount) ==
01241                 req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NIOBUF_REMOTE),
01242                 "want %p - real %p\n", req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill,
01243                 &RMF_NIOBUF_REMOTE), (void *)(niobuf - niocount));
01244 
01245         osc_announce_cached(cli, &body->oa, opc == OST_WRITE ? requested_nob:0);
01246         if (resend) {
01247                 if ((body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS) == 0) {
01248                         body->oa.o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLFLAGS;
01249                         body->oa.o_flags = 0;
01250                 }
01251                 body->oa.o_flags |= OBD_FL_RECOV_RESEND;
01252         }
01253 
01254         if (osc_should_shrink_grant(cli))
01255                 osc_shrink_grant_local(cli, &body->oa);
01256 
01257         /* size[REQ_REC_OFF] still sizeof (*body) */
01258         if (opc == OST_WRITE) {
01259                 if (cli->cl_checksum &&
01260                     !sptlrpc_flavor_has_bulk(&req->rq_flvr)) {
01261                         /* store cl_cksum_type in a local variable since
01262                          * it can be changed via lprocfs */
01263                         cksum_type_t cksum_type = cli->cl_cksum_type;
01264 
01265                         if ((body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS) == 0) {
01266                                 oa->o_flags &= OBD_FL_LOCAL_MASK;
01267                                 body->oa.o_flags = 0;
01268                         }
01269                         body->oa.o_flags |= cksum_type_pack(cksum_type);
01270                         body->oa.o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLCKSUM | OBD_MD_FLFLAGS;
01271                         body->oa.o_cksum = osc_checksum_bulk(requested_nob,
01272                                                              page_count, pga,
01273                                                              OST_WRITE,
01274                                                              cksum_type);
01275                         CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "checksum at write origin: %x\n",
01276                                body->oa.o_cksum);
01277                         /* save this in 'oa', too, for later checking */
01278                         oa->o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLCKSUM | OBD_MD_FLFLAGS;
01279                         oa->o_flags |= cksum_type_pack(cksum_type);
01280                 } else {
01281                         /* clear out the checksum flag, in case this is a
01282                          * resend but cl_checksum is no longer set. b=11238 */
01283                         oa->o_valid &= ~OBD_MD_FLCKSUM;
01284                 }
01285                 oa->o_cksum = body->oa.o_cksum;
01286                 /* 1 RC per niobuf */
01287                 req_capsule_set_size(pill, &RMF_RCS, RCL_SERVER,
01288                                      sizeof(__u32) * niocount);
01289         } else {
01290                 if (cli->cl_checksum &&
01291                     !sptlrpc_flavor_has_bulk(&req->rq_flvr)) {
01292                         if ((body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS) == 0)
01293                                 body->oa.o_flags = 0;
01294                         body->oa.o_flags |= cksum_type_pack(cli->cl_cksum_type);
01295                         body->oa.o_valid |= OBD_MD_FLCKSUM | OBD_MD_FLFLAGS;
01296                 }
01297         }
01298         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01299 
01300         CLASSERT(sizeof(*aa) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
01301         aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
01302         aa->aa_oa = oa;
01303         aa->aa_requested_nob = requested_nob;
01304         aa->aa_nio_count = niocount;
01305         aa->aa_page_count = page_count;
01306         aa->aa_resends = 0;
01307         aa->aa_ppga = pga;
01308         aa->aa_cli = cli;
01309         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&aa->aa_oaps);
01310 
01311         *reqp = req;
01312         niobuf = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_NIOBUF_REMOTE);
01313         CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "brw rpc %p - object "DOSTID" offset %lld<>%lld\n",
01314                 req, POSTID(&oa->o_oi), niobuf[0].rnb_offset,
01315                 niobuf[niocount - 1].rnb_offset + niobuf[niocount - 1].rnb_len);
01316         RETURN(0);
01317 
01318  out:
01319         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01320         RETURN(rc);
01321 }
01322 
01323 static int check_write_checksum(struct obdo *oa, const lnet_process_id_t *peer,
01324                                 __u32 client_cksum, __u32 server_cksum, int nob,
01325                                 size_t page_count, struct brw_page **pga,
01326                                 cksum_type_t client_cksum_type)
01327 {
01328         __u32 new_cksum;
01329         char *msg;
01330         cksum_type_t cksum_type;
01331 
01332         if (server_cksum == client_cksum) {
01333                 CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "checksum %x confirmed\n", client_cksum);
01334                 return 0;
01335         }
01336 
01337         cksum_type = cksum_type_unpack(oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFLAGS ?
01338                                        oa->o_flags : 0);
01339         new_cksum = osc_checksum_bulk(nob, page_count, pga, OST_WRITE,
01340                                       cksum_type);
01341 
01342         if (cksum_type != client_cksum_type)
01343                 msg = "the server did not use the checksum type specified in "
01344                       "the original request - likely a protocol problem";
01345         else if (new_cksum == server_cksum)
01346                 msg = "changed on the client after we checksummed it - "
01347                       "likely false positive due to mmap IO (bug 11742)";
01348         else if (new_cksum == client_cksum)
01349                 msg = "changed in transit before arrival at OST";
01350         else
01351                 msg = "changed in transit AND doesn't match the original - "
01352                       "likely false positive due to mmap IO (bug 11742)";
01353 
01354         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x132, "BAD WRITE CHECKSUM: %s: from %s inode "DFID
01355                            " object "DOSTID" extent ["LPU64"-"LPU64"]\n",
01356                            msg, libcfs_nid2str(peer->nid),
01357                            oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFID ? oa->o_parent_seq : (__u64)0,
01358                            oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFID ? oa->o_parent_oid : 0,
01359                            oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFID ? oa->o_parent_ver : 0,
01360                            POSTID(&oa->o_oi), pga[0]->off,
01361                            pga[page_count-1]->off + pga[page_count-1]->count - 1);
01362         CERROR("original client csum %x (type %x), server csum %x (type %x), "
01363                "client csum now %x\n", client_cksum, client_cksum_type,
01364                server_cksum, cksum_type, new_cksum);
01365         return 1;
01366 }
01367 
01368 /* Note rc enters this function as number of bytes transferred */
01369 static int osc_brw_fini_request(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int rc)
01370 {
01371         struct osc_brw_async_args *aa = (void *)&req->rq_async_args;
01372         const lnet_process_id_t *peer =
01373                         &req->rq_import->imp_connection->c_peer;
01374         struct client_obd *cli = aa->aa_cli;
01375         struct ost_body *body;
01376         u32 client_cksum = 0;
01377         ENTRY;
01378 
01379         if (rc < 0 && rc != -EDQUOT) {
01380                 DEBUG_REQ(D_INFO, req, "Failed request with rc = %d\n", rc);
01381                 RETURN(rc);
01382         }
01383 
01384         LASSERTF(req->rq_repmsg != NULL, "rc = %d\n", rc);
01385         body = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
01386         if (body == NULL) {
01387                 DEBUG_REQ(D_INFO, req, "Can't unpack body\n");
01388                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01389         }
01390 
01391         /* set/clear over quota flag for a uid/gid */
01392         if (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == OST_WRITE &&
01393             body->oa.o_valid & (OBD_MD_FLUSRQUOTA | OBD_MD_FLGRPQUOTA)) {
01394                 unsigned int qid[MAXQUOTAS] = { body->oa.o_uid, body->oa.o_gid };
01395 
01396                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "setdq for [%u %u] with valid "LPX64", flags %x\n",
01397                        body->oa.o_uid, body->oa.o_gid, body->oa.o_valid,
01398                        body->oa.o_flags);
01399                 osc_quota_setdq(cli, qid, body->oa.o_valid, body->oa.o_flags);
01400         }
01401 
01402         osc_update_grant(cli, body);
01403 
01404         if (rc < 0)
01405                 RETURN(rc);
01406 
01407         if (aa->aa_oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLCKSUM)
01408                 client_cksum = aa->aa_oa->o_cksum; /* save for later */
01409 
01410         if (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == OST_WRITE) {
01411                 if (rc > 0) {
01412                         CERROR("Unexpected +ve rc %d\n", rc);
01413                         RETURN(-EPROTO);
01414                 }
01415                 LASSERT(req->rq_bulk->bd_nob == aa->aa_requested_nob);
01416 
01417                 if (sptlrpc_cli_unwrap_bulk_write(req, req->rq_bulk))
01418                         RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01419 
01420                 if ((aa->aa_oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLCKSUM) && client_cksum &&
01421                     check_write_checksum(&body->oa, peer, client_cksum,
01422                                          body->oa.o_cksum, aa->aa_requested_nob,
01423                                          aa->aa_page_count, aa->aa_ppga,
01424                                          cksum_type_unpack(aa->aa_oa->o_flags)))
01425                         RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01426 
01427                 rc = check_write_rcs(req, aa->aa_requested_nob,aa->aa_nio_count,
01428                                      aa->aa_page_count, aa->aa_ppga);
01429                 GOTO(out, rc);
01430         }
01431 
01432         /* The rest of this function executes only for OST_READs */
01433 
01434         /* if unwrap_bulk failed, return -EAGAIN to retry */
01435         rc = sptlrpc_cli_unwrap_bulk_read(req, req->rq_bulk, rc);
01436         if (rc < 0)
01437                 GOTO(out, rc = -EAGAIN);
01438 
01439         if (rc > aa->aa_requested_nob) {
01440                 CERROR("Unexpected rc %d (%d requested)\n", rc,
01441                        aa->aa_requested_nob);
01442                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
01443         }
01444 
01445         if (rc != req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred) {
01446                 CERROR ("Unexpected rc %d (%d transferred)\n",
01447                         rc, req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred);
01448                 return (-EPROTO);
01449         }
01450 
01451         if (rc < aa->aa_requested_nob)
01452                 handle_short_read(rc, aa->aa_page_count, aa->aa_ppga);
01453 
01454         if (body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLCKSUM) {
01455                 static int cksum_counter;
01456                 u32        server_cksum = body->oa.o_cksum;
01457                 char      *via = "";
01458                 char      *router = "";
01459                 cksum_type_t cksum_type;
01460 
01461                 cksum_type = cksum_type_unpack(body->oa.o_valid &OBD_MD_FLFLAGS?
01462                                                body->oa.o_flags : 0);
01463                 client_cksum = osc_checksum_bulk(rc, aa->aa_page_count,
01464                                                  aa->aa_ppga, OST_READ,
01465                                                  cksum_type);
01466 
01467                 if (peer->nid != req->rq_bulk->bd_sender) {
01468                         via = " via ";
01469                         router = libcfs_nid2str(req->rq_bulk->bd_sender);
01470                 }
01471 
01472                 if (server_cksum != client_cksum) {
01473                         LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x133, "%s: BAD READ CHECKSUM: from "
01474                                            "%s%s%s inode "DFID" object "DOSTID
01475                                            " extent ["LPU64"-"LPU64"]\n",
01476                                            req->rq_import->imp_obd->obd_name,
01477                                            libcfs_nid2str(peer->nid),
01478                                            via, router,
01479                                            body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFID ?
01480                                                 body->oa.o_parent_seq : (__u64)0,
01481                                            body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFID ?
01482                                                 body->oa.o_parent_oid : 0,
01483                                            body->oa.o_valid & OBD_MD_FLFID ?
01484                                                 body->oa.o_parent_ver : 0,
01485                                            POSTID(&body->oa.o_oi),
01486                                            aa->aa_ppga[0]->off,
01487                                            aa->aa_ppga[aa->aa_page_count-1]->off +
01488                                            aa->aa_ppga[aa->aa_page_count-1]->count -
01489                                                                         1);
01490                         CERROR("client %x, server %x, cksum_type %x\n",
01491                                client_cksum, server_cksum, cksum_type);
01492                         cksum_counter = 0;
01493                         aa->aa_oa->o_cksum = client_cksum;
01494                         rc = -EAGAIN;
01495                 } else {
01496                         cksum_counter++;
01497                         CDEBUG(D_PAGE, "checksum %x confirmed\n", client_cksum);
01498                         rc = 0;
01499                 }
01500         } else if (unlikely(client_cksum)) {
01501                 static int cksum_missed;
01502 
01503                 cksum_missed++;
01504                 if ((cksum_missed & (-cksum_missed)) == cksum_missed)
01505                         CERROR("Checksum %u requested from %s but not sent\n",
01506                                cksum_missed, libcfs_nid2str(peer->nid));
01507         } else {
01508                 rc = 0;
01509         }
01510 out:
01511         if (rc >= 0)
01512                 lustre_get_wire_obdo(&req->rq_import->imp_connect_data,
01513                                      aa->aa_oa, &body->oa);
01514 
01515         RETURN(rc);
01516 }
01517 
01518 static int osc_brw_redo_request(struct ptlrpc_request *request,
01519                                 struct osc_brw_async_args *aa, int rc)
01520 {
01521         struct ptlrpc_request *new_req;
01522         struct osc_brw_async_args *new_aa;
01523         struct osc_async_page *oap;
01524         ENTRY;
01525 
01526         DEBUG_REQ(rc == -EINPROGRESS ? D_RPCTRACE : D_ERROR, request,
01527                   "redo for recoverable error %d", rc);
01528 
01529         rc = osc_brw_prep_request(lustre_msg_get_opc(request->rq_reqmsg) ==
01530                                 OST_WRITE ? OBD_BRW_WRITE : OBD_BRW_READ,
01531                                   aa->aa_cli, aa->aa_oa, aa->aa_page_count,
01532                                   aa->aa_ppga, &new_req, 1);
01533         if (rc)
01534                 RETURN(rc);
01535 
01536         list_for_each_entry(oap, &aa->aa_oaps, oap_rpc_item) {
01537                 if (oap->oap_request != NULL) {
01538                         LASSERTF(request == oap->oap_request,
01539                                  "request %p != oap_request %p\n",
01540                                  request, oap->oap_request);
01541                         if (oap->oap_interrupted) {
01542                                 ptlrpc_req_finished(new_req);
01543                                 RETURN(-EINTR);
01544                         }
01545                 }
01546         }
01547         /* New request takes over pga and oaps from old request.
01548          * Note that copying a list_head doesn't work, need to move it... */
01549         aa->aa_resends++;
01550         new_req->rq_interpret_reply = request->rq_interpret_reply;
01551         new_req->rq_async_args = request->rq_async_args;
01552         new_req->rq_commit_cb = request->rq_commit_cb;
01553         /* cap resend delay to the current request timeout, this is similar to
01554          * what ptlrpc does (see after_reply()) */
01555         if (aa->aa_resends > new_req->rq_timeout)
01556                 new_req->rq_sent = cfs_time_current_sec() + new_req->rq_timeout;
01557         else
01558                 new_req->rq_sent = cfs_time_current_sec() + aa->aa_resends;
01559         new_req->rq_generation_set = 1;
01560         new_req->rq_import_generation = request->rq_import_generation;
01561 
01562         new_aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(new_req);
01563 
01564         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&new_aa->aa_oaps);
01565         list_splice_init(&aa->aa_oaps, &new_aa->aa_oaps);
01566         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&new_aa->aa_exts);
01567         list_splice_init(&aa->aa_exts, &new_aa->aa_exts);
01568         new_aa->aa_resends = aa->aa_resends;
01569 
01570         list_for_each_entry(oap, &new_aa->aa_oaps, oap_rpc_item) {
01571                 if (oap->oap_request) {
01572                         ptlrpc_req_finished(oap->oap_request);
01573                         oap->oap_request = ptlrpc_request_addref(new_req);
01574                 }
01575         }
01576 
01577         /* XXX: This code will run into problem if we're going to support
01578          * to add a series of BRW RPCs into a self-defined ptlrpc_request_set
01579          * and wait for all of them to be finished. We should inherit request
01580          * set from old request. */
01581         ptlrpcd_add_req(new_req);
01582 
01583         DEBUG_REQ(D_INFO, new_req, "new request");
01584         RETURN(0);
01585 }
01586 
01587 /*
01588  * ugh, we want disk allocation on the target to happen in offset order.  we'll
01589  * follow sedgewicks advice and stick to the dead simple shellsort -- it'll do
01590  * fine for our small page arrays and doesn't require allocation.  its an
01591  * insertion sort that swaps elements that are strides apart, shrinking the
01592  * stride down until its '1' and the array is sorted.
01593  */
01594 static void sort_brw_pages(struct brw_page **array, int num)
01595 {
01596         int stride, i, j;
01597         struct brw_page *tmp;
01598 
01599         if (num == 1)
01600                 return;
01601         for (stride = 1; stride < num ; stride = (stride * 3) + 1)
01602                 ;
01603 
01604         do {
01605                 stride /= 3;
01606                 for (i = stride ; i < num ; i++) {
01607                         tmp = array[i];
01608                         j = i;
01609                         while (j >= stride && array[j - stride]->off > tmp->off) {
01610                                 array[j] = array[j - stride];
01611                                 j -= stride;
01612                         }
01613                         array[j] = tmp;
01614                 }
01615         } while (stride > 1);
01616 }
01617 
01618 static void osc_release_ppga(struct brw_page **ppga, size_t count)
01619 {
01620         LASSERT(ppga != NULL);
01621         OBD_FREE(ppga, sizeof(*ppga) * count);
01622 }
01623 
01624 static int brw_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
01625                          struct ptlrpc_request *req, void *data, int rc)
01626 {
01627         struct osc_brw_async_args *aa = data;
01628         struct osc_extent *ext;
01629         struct osc_extent *tmp;
01630         struct client_obd *cli = aa->aa_cli;
01631         ENTRY;
01632 
01633         rc = osc_brw_fini_request(req, rc);
01634         CDEBUG(D_INODE, "request %p aa %p rc %d\n", req, aa, rc);
01635         /* When server return -EINPROGRESS, client should always retry
01636          * regardless of the number of times the bulk was resent already. */
01637         if (osc_recoverable_error(rc)) {
01638                 if (req->rq_import_generation !=
01639                     req->rq_import->imp_generation) {
01640                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: resend cross eviction for object: "
01641                                ""DOSTID", rc = %d.\n",
01642                                req->rq_import->imp_obd->obd_name,
01643                                POSTID(&aa->aa_oa->o_oi), rc);
01644                 } else if (rc == -EINPROGRESS ||
01645                     client_should_resend(aa->aa_resends, aa->aa_cli)) {
01646                         rc = osc_brw_redo_request(req, aa, rc);
01647                 } else {
01648                         CERROR("%s: too many resent retries for object: "
01649                                ""LPU64":"LPU64", rc = %d.\n",
01650                                req->rq_import->imp_obd->obd_name,
01651                                POSTID(&aa->aa_oa->o_oi), rc);
01652                 }
01653 
01654                 if (rc == 0)
01655                         RETURN(0);
01656                 else if (rc == -EAGAIN || rc == -EINPROGRESS)
01657                         rc = -EIO;
01658         }
01659 
01660         if (rc == 0) {
01661                 struct obdo *oa = aa->aa_oa;
01662                 struct cl_attr *attr = &osc_env_info(env)->oti_attr;
01663                 unsigned long valid = 0;
01664                 struct cl_object *obj;
01665                 struct osc_async_page *last;
01666 
01667                 last = brw_page2oap(aa->aa_ppga[aa->aa_page_count - 1]);
01668                 obj = osc2cl(last->oap_obj);
01669 
01670                 cl_object_attr_lock(obj);
01671                 if (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLBLOCKS) {
01672                         attr->cat_blocks = oa->o_blocks;
01673                         valid |= CAT_BLOCKS;
01674                 }
01675                 if (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLMTIME) {
01676                         attr->cat_mtime = oa->o_mtime;
01677                         valid |= CAT_MTIME;
01678                 }
01679                 if (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLATIME) {
01680                         attr->cat_atime = oa->o_atime;
01681                         valid |= CAT_ATIME;
01682                 }
01683                 if (oa->o_valid & OBD_MD_FLCTIME) {
01684                         attr->cat_ctime = oa->o_ctime;
01685                         valid |= CAT_CTIME;
01686                 }
01687 
01688                 if (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == OST_WRITE) {
01689                         struct lov_oinfo *loi = cl2osc(obj)->oo_oinfo;
01690                         loff_t last_off = last->oap_count + last->oap_obj_off +
01691                                 last->oap_page_off;
01692 
01693                         /* Change file size if this is an out of quota or
01694                          * direct IO write and it extends the file size */
01695                         if (loi->loi_lvb.lvb_size < last_off) {
01696                                 attr->cat_size = last_off;
01697                                 valid |= CAT_SIZE;
01698                         }
01699                         /* Extend KMS if it's not a lockless write */
01700                         if (loi->loi_kms < last_off &&
01701                             oap2osc_page(last)->ops_srvlock == 0) {
01702                                 attr->cat_kms = last_off;
01703                                 valid |= CAT_KMS;
01704                         }
01705                 }
01706 
01707                 if (valid != 0)
01708                         cl_object_attr_update(env, obj, attr, valid);
01709                 cl_object_attr_unlock(obj);
01710         }
01711         OBDO_FREE(aa->aa_oa);
01712 
01713         if (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == OST_WRITE && rc == 0)
01714                 osc_inc_unstable_pages(req);
01715 
01716         list_for_each_entry_safe(ext, tmp, &aa->aa_exts, oe_link) {
01717                 list_del_init(&ext->oe_link);
01718                 osc_extent_finish(env, ext, 1, rc);
01719         }
01720         LASSERT(list_empty(&aa->aa_exts));
01721         LASSERT(list_empty(&aa->aa_oaps));
01722 
01723         osc_release_ppga(aa->aa_ppga, aa->aa_page_count);
01724         ptlrpc_lprocfs_brw(req, req->rq_bulk->bd_nob_transferred);
01725 
01726         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01727         /* We need to decrement before osc_ap_completion->osc_wake_cache_waiters
01728          * is called so we know whether to go to sync BRWs or wait for more
01729          * RPCs to complete */
01730         if (lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == OST_WRITE)
01731                 cli->cl_w_in_flight--;
01732         else
01733                 cli->cl_r_in_flight--;
01734         osc_wake_cache_waiters(cli);
01735         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01736 
01737         osc_io_unplug(env, cli, NULL);
01738         RETURN(rc);
01739 }
01740 
01741 static void brw_commit(struct ptlrpc_request *req)
01742 {
01743         /* If osc_inc_unstable_pages (via osc_extent_finish) races with
01744          * this called via the rq_commit_cb, I need to ensure
01745          * osc_dec_unstable_pages is still called. Otherwise unstable
01746          * pages may be leaked. */
01747         spin_lock(&req->rq_lock);
01748         if (likely(req->rq_unstable)) {
01749                 req->rq_unstable = 0;
01750                 spin_unlock(&req->rq_lock);
01751 
01752                 osc_dec_unstable_pages(req);
01753         } else {
01754                 req->rq_committed = 1;
01755                 spin_unlock(&req->rq_lock);
01756         }
01757 }
01758 
01764 int osc_build_rpc(const struct lu_env *env, struct client_obd *cli,
01765                   struct list_head *ext_list, int cmd)
01766 {
01767         struct ptlrpc_request           *req = NULL;
01768         struct osc_extent               *ext;
01769         struct brw_page                 **pga = NULL;
01770         struct osc_brw_async_args       *aa = NULL;
01771         struct obdo                     *oa = NULL;
01772         struct osc_async_page           *oap;
01773         struct osc_object               *obj = NULL;
01774         struct cl_req_attr              *crattr = NULL;
01775         loff_t                          starting_offset = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
01776         loff_t                          ending_offset = 0;
01777         int                             mpflag = 0;
01778         int                             mem_tight = 0;
01779         int                             page_count = 0;
01780         bool                            soft_sync = false;
01781         bool                            interrupted = false;
01782         int                             i;
01783         int                             grant = 0;
01784         int                             rc;
01785         struct list_head                rpc_list = LIST_HEAD_INIT(rpc_list);
01786         struct ost_body                 *body;
01787         ENTRY;
01788         LASSERT(!list_empty(ext_list));
01789 
01790         /* add pages into rpc_list to build BRW rpc */
01791         list_for_each_entry(ext, ext_list, oe_link) {
01792                 LASSERT(ext->oe_state == OES_RPC);
01793                 mem_tight |= ext->oe_memalloc;
01794                 grant += ext->oe_grants;
01795                 page_count += ext->oe_nr_pages;
01796                 if (obj == NULL)
01797                         obj = ext->oe_obj;
01798         }
01799 
01800         soft_sync = osc_over_unstable_soft_limit(cli);
01801         if (mem_tight)
01802                 mpflag = cfs_memory_pressure_get_and_set();
01803 
01804         OBD_ALLOC(pga, sizeof(*pga) * page_count);
01805         if (pga == NULL)
01806                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01807 
01808         OBDO_ALLOC(oa);
01809         if (oa == NULL)
01810                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01811 
01812         i = 0;
01813         list_for_each_entry(ext, ext_list, oe_link) {
01814                 list_for_each_entry(oap, &ext->oe_pages, oap_pending_item) {
01815                         if (mem_tight)
01816                                 oap->oap_brw_flags |= OBD_BRW_MEMALLOC;
01817                         if (soft_sync)
01818                                 oap->oap_brw_flags |= OBD_BRW_SOFT_SYNC;
01819                         pga[i] = &oap->oap_brw_page;
01820                         pga[i]->off = oap->oap_obj_off + oap->oap_page_off;
01821                         i++;
01822 
01823                         list_add_tail(&oap->oap_rpc_item, &rpc_list);
01824                         if (starting_offset == OBD_OBJECT_EOF ||
01825                             starting_offset > oap->oap_obj_off)
01826                                 starting_offset = oap->oap_obj_off;
01827                         else
01828                                 LASSERT(oap->oap_page_off == 0);
01829                         if (ending_offset < oap->oap_obj_off + oap->oap_count)
01830                                 ending_offset = oap->oap_obj_off +
01831                                                 oap->oap_count;
01832                         else
01833                                 LASSERT(oap->oap_page_off + oap->oap_count ==
01834                                         PAGE_CACHE_SIZE);
01835                         if (oap->oap_interrupted)
01836                                 interrupted = true;
01837                 }
01838         }
01839 
01840         /* first page in the list */
01841         oap = list_entry(rpc_list.next, typeof(*oap), oap_rpc_item);
01842 
01843         crattr = &osc_env_info(env)->oti_req_attr;
01844         memset(crattr, 0, sizeof(*crattr));
01845         crattr->cra_type = (cmd & OBD_BRW_WRITE) ? CRT_WRITE : CRT_READ;
01846         crattr->cra_flags = ~0ULL;
01847         crattr->cra_page = oap2cl_page(oap);
01848         crattr->cra_oa = oa;
01849         cl_req_attr_set(env, osc2cl(obj), crattr);
01850 
01851         if (cmd == OBD_BRW_WRITE)
01852                 oa->o_grant_used = grant;
01853 
01854         sort_brw_pages(pga, page_count);
01855         rc = osc_brw_prep_request(cmd, cli, oa, page_count, pga, &req, 0);
01856         if (rc != 0) {
01857                 CERROR("prep_req failed: %d\n", rc);
01858                 GOTO(out, rc);
01859         }
01860 
01861         req->rq_commit_cb = brw_commit;
01862         req->rq_interpret_reply = brw_interpret;
01863         req->rq_memalloc = mem_tight != 0;
01864         oap->oap_request = ptlrpc_request_addref(req);
01865         if (interrupted && !req->rq_intr)
01866                 ptlrpc_mark_interrupted(req);
01867 
01868         /* Need to update the timestamps after the request is built in case
01869          * we race with setattr (locally or in queue at OST).  If OST gets
01870          * later setattr before earlier BRW (as determined by the request xid),
01871          * the OST will not use BRW timestamps.  Sadly, there is no obvious
01872          * way to do this in a single call.  bug 10150 */
01873         body = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OST_BODY);
01874         crattr->cra_oa = &body->oa;
01875         crattr->cra_flags = OBD_MD_FLMTIME|OBD_MD_FLCTIME|OBD_MD_FLATIME;
01876         cl_req_attr_set(env, osc2cl(obj), crattr);
01877         lustre_msg_set_jobid(req->rq_reqmsg, crattr->cra_jobid);
01878 
01879         CLASSERT(sizeof(*aa) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
01880         aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
01881         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&aa->aa_oaps);
01882         list_splice_init(&rpc_list, &aa->aa_oaps);
01883         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&aa->aa_exts);
01884         list_splice_init(ext_list, &aa->aa_exts);
01885 
01886         spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01887         starting_offset >>= PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
01888         if (cmd == OBD_BRW_READ) {
01889                 cli->cl_r_in_flight++;
01890                 lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&cli->cl_read_page_hist, page_count);
01891                 lprocfs_oh_tally(&cli->cl_read_rpc_hist, cli->cl_r_in_flight);
01892                 lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&cli->cl_read_offset_hist,
01893                                       starting_offset + 1);
01894         } else {
01895                 cli->cl_w_in_flight++;
01896                 lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&cli->cl_write_page_hist, page_count);
01897                 lprocfs_oh_tally(&cli->cl_write_rpc_hist, cli->cl_w_in_flight);
01898                 lprocfs_oh_tally_log2(&cli->cl_write_offset_hist,
