01899                                       starting_offset + 1);
01900         }
01901         spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
01902 
01903         DEBUG_REQ(D_INODE, req, "%d pages, aa %p. now %ur/%uw in flight",
01904                   page_count, aa, cli->cl_r_in_flight,
01905                   cli->cl_w_in_flight);
01906 
01907         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
01908         rc = 0;
01909         EXIT;
01910 
01911 out:
01912         if (mem_tight != 0)
01913                 cfs_memory_pressure_restore(mpflag);
01914 
01915         if (rc != 0) {
01916                 LASSERT(req == NULL);
01917 
01918                 if (oa)
01919                         OBDO_FREE(oa);
01920                 if (pga)
01921                         OBD_FREE(pga, sizeof(*pga) * page_count);
01922                 /* this should happen rarely and is pretty bad, it makes the
01923                  * pending list not follow the dirty order */
01924                 while (!list_empty(ext_list)) {
01925                         ext = list_entry(ext_list->next, struct osc_extent,
01926                                          oe_link);
01927                         list_del_init(&ext->oe_link);
01928                         osc_extent_finish(env, ext, 0, rc);
01929                 }
01930         }
01931         RETURN(rc);
01932 }
01933 
01934 static int osc_set_lock_data(struct ldlm_lock *lock, void *data)
01935 {
01936         int set = 0;
01937 
01938         LASSERT(lock != NULL);
01939 
01940         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
01941 
01942         if (lock->l_ast_data == NULL)
01943                 lock->l_ast_data = data;
01944         if (lock->l_ast_data == data)
01945                 set = 1;
01946 
01947         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
01948 
01949         return set;
01950 }
01951 
01952 static int osc_enqueue_fini(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01953                             osc_enqueue_upcall_f upcall, void *cookie,
01954                             struct lustre_handle *lockh, enum ldlm_mode mode,
01955                             __u64 *flags, int agl, int errcode)
01956 {
01957         bool intent = *flags & LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT;
01958         int rc;
01959         ENTRY;
01960 
01961         /* The request was created before ldlm_cli_enqueue call. */
01962         if (intent && errcode == ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED) {
01963                 struct ldlm_reply *rep;
01964 
01965                 rep = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REP);
01966                 LASSERT(rep != NULL);
01967 
01968                 rep->lock_policy_res1 =
01969                         ptlrpc_status_ntoh(rep->lock_policy_res1);
01970                 if (rep->lock_policy_res1)
01971                         errcode = rep->lock_policy_res1;
01972                 if (!agl)
01973                         *flags |= LDLM_FL_LVB_READY;
01974         } else if (errcode == ELDLM_OK) {
01975                 *flags |= LDLM_FL_LVB_READY;
01976         }
01977 
01978         /* Call the update callback. */
01979         rc = (*upcall)(cookie, lockh, errcode);
01980 
01981         /* release the reference taken in ldlm_cli_enqueue() */
01982         if (errcode == ELDLM_LOCK_MATCHED)
01983                 errcode = ELDLM_OK;
01984         if (errcode == ELDLM_OK && lustre_handle_is_used(lockh))
01985                 ldlm_lock_decref(lockh, mode);
01986 
01987         RETURN(rc);
01988 }
01989 
01990 static int osc_enqueue_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
01991                                  struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01992                                  struct osc_enqueue_args *aa, int rc)
01993 {
01994         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
01995         struct lustre_handle *lockh = &aa->oa_lockh;
01996         enum ldlm_mode mode = aa->oa_mode;
01997         struct ost_lvb *lvb = aa->oa_lvb;
01998         __u32 lvb_len = sizeof(*lvb);
01999         __u64 flags = 0;
02000 
02001         ENTRY;
02002 
02003         /* ldlm_cli_enqueue is holding a reference on the lock, so it must
02004          * be valid. */
02005         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
02006         LASSERTF(lock != NULL,
02007                  "lockh "LPX64", req %p, aa %p - client evicted?\n",
02008                  lockh->cookie, req, aa);
02009 
02010         /* Take an additional reference so that a blocking AST that
02011          * ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini() might post for a failed lock, is guaranteed
02012          * to arrive after an upcall has been executed by
02013          * osc_enqueue_fini(). */
02014         ldlm_lock_addref(lockh, mode);
02015 
02016         /* Let cl_lock_state_wait fail with -ERESTARTSYS to unuse sublocks. */
02017         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LDLM_ENQUEUE_HANG, 2);
02018 
02019         /* Let CP AST to grant the lock first. */
02020         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CP_ENQ_RACE, 1);
02021 
02022         if (aa->oa_agl) {
02023                 LASSERT(aa->oa_lvb == NULL);
02024                 LASSERT(aa->oa_flags == NULL);
02025                 aa->oa_flags = &flags;
02026         }
02027 
02028         /* Complete obtaining the lock procedure. */
02029         rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini(aa->oa_exp, req, aa->oa_type, 1,
02030                                    aa->oa_mode, aa->oa_flags, lvb, lvb_len,
02031                                    lockh, rc);
02032         /* Complete osc stuff. */
02033         rc = osc_enqueue_fini(req, aa->oa_upcall, aa->oa_cookie, lockh, mode,
02034                               aa->oa_flags, aa->oa_agl, rc);
02035 
02036         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_OSC_CP_CANCEL_RACE, 10);
02037 
02038         ldlm_lock_decref(lockh, mode);
02039         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
02040         RETURN(rc);
02041 }
02042 
02043 struct ptlrpc_request_set *PTLRPCD_SET = (void *)1;
02044 
02045 /* When enqueuing asynchronously, locks are not ordered, we can obtain a lock
02046  * from the 2nd OSC before a lock from the 1st one. This does not deadlock with
02047  * other synchronous requests, however keeping some locks and trying to obtain
02048  * others may take a considerable amount of time in a case of ost failure; and
02049  * when other sync requests do not get released lock from a client, the client
02050  * is evicted from the cluster -- such scenarious make the life difficult, so
02051  * release locks just after they are obtained. */
02052 int osc_enqueue_base(struct obd_export *exp, struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
02053                      __u64 *flags, union ldlm_policy_data *policy,
02054                      struct ost_lvb *lvb, int kms_valid,
02055                      osc_enqueue_upcall_f upcall, void *cookie,
02056                      struct ldlm_enqueue_info *einfo,
02057                      struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset, int async, int agl)
02058 {
02059         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
02060         struct lustre_handle lockh = { 0 };
02061         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
02062         int intent = *flags & LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT;
02063         __u64 match_flags = *flags;
02064         enum ldlm_mode mode;
02065         int rc;
02066         ENTRY;
02067 
02068         /* Filesystem lock extents are extended to page boundaries so that
02069          * dealing with the page cache is a little smoother.  */
02070         policy->l_extent.start -= policy->l_extent.start & ~PAGE_MASK;
02071         policy->l_extent.end |= ~PAGE_MASK;
02072 
02073         /*
02074          * kms is not valid when either object is completely fresh (so that no
02075          * locks are cached), or object was evicted. In the latter case cached
02076          * lock cannot be used, because it would prime inode state with
02077          * potentially stale LVB.
02078          */
02079         if (!kms_valid)
02080                 goto no_match;
02081 
02082         /* Next, search for already existing extent locks that will cover us */
02083         /* If we're trying to read, we also search for an existing PW lock.  The
02084          * VFS and page cache already protect us locally, so lots of readers/
02085          * writers can share a single PW lock.
02086          *
02087          * There are problems with conversion deadlocks, so instead of
02088          * converting a read lock to a write lock, we'll just enqueue a new
02089          * one.
02090          *
02091          * At some point we should cancel the read lock instead of making them
02092          * send us a blocking callback, but there are problems with canceling
02093          * locks out from other users right now, too. */
02094         mode = einfo->ei_mode;
02095         if (einfo->ei_mode == LCK_PR)
02096                 mode |= LCK_PW;
02097         if (agl == 0)
02098                 match_flags |= LDLM_FL_LVB_READY;
02099         if (intent != 0)
02100                 match_flags |= LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED;
02101         mode = ldlm_lock_match(obd->obd_namespace, match_flags, res_id,
02102                                einfo->ei_type, policy, mode, &lockh, 0);
02103         if (mode) {
02104                 struct ldlm_lock *matched;
02105 
02106                 if (*flags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK)
02107                         RETURN(ELDLM_OK);
02108 
02109                 matched = ldlm_handle2lock(&lockh);
02110                 if (agl) {
02111                         /* AGL enqueues DLM locks speculatively. Therefore if
02112                          * it already exists a DLM lock, it wll just inform the
02113                          * caller to cancel the AGL process for this stripe. */
02114                         ldlm_lock_decref(&lockh, mode);
02115                         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(matched);
02116                         RETURN(-ECANCELED);
02117                 } else if (osc_set_lock_data(matched, einfo->ei_cbdata)) {
02118                         *flags |= LDLM_FL_LVB_READY;
02119 
02120                         /* We already have a lock, and it's referenced. */
02121                         (*upcall)(cookie, &lockh, ELDLM_LOCK_MATCHED);
02122 
02123                         ldlm_lock_decref(&lockh, mode);
02124                         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(matched);
02125                         RETURN(ELDLM_OK);
02126                 } else {
02127                         ldlm_lock_decref(&lockh, mode);
02128                         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(matched);
02129                 }
02130         }
02131 
02132 no_match:
02133         if (*flags & (LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK | LDLM_FL_MATCH_LOCK))
02134                 RETURN(-ENOLCK);
02135 
02136         if (intent) {
02137                 req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
02138                                            &RQF_LDLM_ENQUEUE_LVB);
02139                 if (req == NULL)
02140                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02141 
02142                 rc = ldlm_prep_enqueue_req(exp, req, NULL, 0);
02143                 if (rc) {
02144                         ptlrpc_request_free(req);
02145                         RETURN(rc);
02146                 }
02147 
02148                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER,
02149                                      sizeof *lvb);
02150                 ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
02151         }
02152 
02153         /* users of osc_enqueue() can pass this flag for ldlm_lock_match() */
02154         *flags &= ~LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED;
02155 
02156         rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue(exp, &req, einfo, res_id, policy, flags, lvb,
02157                               sizeof(*lvb), LVB_T_OST, &lockh, async);
02158         if (async) {
02159                 if (!rc) {
02160                         struct osc_enqueue_args *aa;
02161                         CLASSERT(sizeof(*aa) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
02162                         aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
02163                         aa->oa_exp    = exp;
02164                         aa->oa_mode   = einfo->ei_mode;
02165                         aa->oa_type   = einfo->ei_type;
02166                         lustre_handle_copy(&aa->oa_lockh, &lockh);
02167                         aa->oa_upcall = upcall;
02168                         aa->oa_cookie = cookie;
02169                         aa->oa_agl    = !!agl;
02170                         if (!agl) {
02171                                 aa->oa_flags  = flags;
02172                                 aa->oa_lvb    = lvb;
02173                         } else {
02174                                 /* AGL is essentially to enqueue an DLM lock
02175                                  * in advance, so we don't care about the
02176                                  * result of AGL enqueue. */
02177                                 aa->oa_lvb    = NULL;
02178                                 aa->oa_flags  = NULL;
02179                         }
02180 
02181                         req->rq_interpret_reply =
02182                                 (ptlrpc_interpterer_t)osc_enqueue_interpret;
02183                         if (rqset == PTLRPCD_SET)
02184                                 ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
02185                         else
02186                                 ptlrpc_set_add_req(rqset, req);
02187                 } else if (intent) {
02188                         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02189                 }
02190                 RETURN(rc);
02191         }
02192 
02193         rc = osc_enqueue_fini(req, upcall, cookie, &lockh, einfo->ei_mode,
02194                               flags, agl, rc);
02195         if (intent)
02196                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02197 
02198         RETURN(rc);
02199 }
02200 
02201 int osc_match_base(struct obd_export *exp, struct ldlm_res_id *res_id,
02202                    enum ldlm_type type, union ldlm_policy_data *policy,
02203                    enum ldlm_mode mode, __u64 *flags, void *data,
02204                    struct lustre_handle *lockh, int unref)
02205 {
02206         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
02207         __u64 lflags = *flags;
02208         enum ldlm_mode rc;
02209         ENTRY;
02210 
02211         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_OSC_MATCH))
02212                 RETURN(-EIO);
02213 
02214         /* Filesystem lock extents are extended to page boundaries so that
02215          * dealing with the page cache is a little smoother */
02216         policy->l_extent.start -= policy->l_extent.start & ~PAGE_MASK;
02217         policy->l_extent.end |= ~PAGE_MASK;
02218 
02219         /* Next, search for already existing extent locks that will cover us */
02220         /* If we're trying to read, we also search for an existing PW lock.  The
02221          * VFS and page cache already protect us locally, so lots of readers/
02222          * writers can share a single PW lock. */
02223         rc = mode;
02224         if (mode == LCK_PR)
02225                 rc |= LCK_PW;
02226         rc = ldlm_lock_match(obd->obd_namespace, lflags,
02227                              res_id, type, policy, rc, lockh, unref);
02228         if (rc == 0 || lflags & LDLM_FL_TEST_LOCK)
02229                 RETURN(rc);
02230 
02231         if (data != NULL) {
02232                 struct ldlm_lock *lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
02233 
02234                 LASSERT(lock != NULL);
02235                 if (!osc_set_lock_data(lock, data)) {
02236                         ldlm_lock_decref(lockh, rc);
02237                         rc = 0;
02238                 }
02239                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
02240         }
02241         RETURN(rc);
02242 }
02243 
02244 static int osc_statfs_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
02245                                 struct ptlrpc_request *req,
02246                                 struct osc_async_args *aa, int rc)
02247 {
02248         struct obd_statfs *msfs;
02249         ENTRY;
02250 
02251         if (rc == -EBADR)
02252                 /* The request has in fact never been sent
02253                  * due to issues at a higher level (LOV).
02254                  * Exit immediately since the caller is
02255                  * aware of the problem and takes care
02256                  * of the clean up */
02257                  RETURN(rc);
02258 
02259         if ((rc == -ENOTCONN || rc == -EAGAIN) &&
02260             (aa->aa_oi->oi_flags & OBD_STATFS_NODELAY))
02261                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
02262 
02263         if (rc != 0)
02264                 GOTO(out, rc);
02265 
02266         msfs = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OBD_STATFS);
02267         if (msfs == NULL) {
02268                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
02269         }
02270 
02271         *aa->aa_oi->oi_osfs = *msfs;
02272 out:
02273         rc = aa->aa_oi->oi_cb_up(aa->aa_oi, rc);
02274         RETURN(rc);
02275 }
02276 
02277 static int osc_statfs_async(struct obd_export *exp,
02278                             struct obd_info *oinfo, __u64 max_age,
02279                             struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset)
02280 {
02281         struct obd_device     *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
02282         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
02283         struct osc_async_args *aa;
02284         int                    rc;
02285         ENTRY;
02286 
02287         /* We could possibly pass max_age in the request (as an absolute
02288          * timestamp or a "seconds.usec ago") so the target can avoid doing
02289          * extra calls into the filesystem if that isn't necessary (e.g.
02290          * during mount that would help a bit).  Having relative timestamps
02291          * is not so great if request processing is slow, while absolute
02292          * timestamps are not ideal because they need time synchronization. */
02293         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(obd->u.cli.cl_import, &RQF_OST_STATFS);
02294         if (req == NULL)
02295                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02296 
02297         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_STATFS);
02298         if (rc) {
02299                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
02300                 RETURN(rc);
02301         }
02302         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
02303         req->rq_request_portal = OST_CREATE_PORTAL;
02304         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
02305 
02306         if (oinfo->oi_flags & OBD_STATFS_NODELAY) {
02307                 /* procfs requests not want stat in wait for avoid deadlock */
02308                 req->rq_no_resend = 1;
02309                 req->rq_no_delay = 1;
02310         }
02311 
02312         req->rq_interpret_reply = (ptlrpc_interpterer_t)osc_statfs_interpret;
02313         CLASSERT (sizeof(*aa) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
02314         aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
02315         aa->aa_oi = oinfo;
02316 
02317         ptlrpc_set_add_req(rqset, req);
02318         RETURN(0);
02319 }
02320 
02321 static int osc_statfs(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
02322                       struct obd_statfs *osfs, __u64 max_age, __u32 flags)
02323 {
02324         struct obd_device     *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
02325         struct obd_statfs     *msfs;
02326         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
02327         struct obd_import     *imp = NULL;
02328         int rc;
02329         ENTRY;
02330 
02331         /*Since the request might also come from lprocfs, so we need
02332          *sync this with client_disconnect_export Bug15684*/
02333         down_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
02334         if (obd->u.cli.cl_import)
02335                 imp = class_import_get(obd->u.cli.cl_import);
02336         up_read(&obd->u.cli.cl_sem);
02337         if (!imp)
02338                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
02339 
02340         /* We could possibly pass max_age in the request (as an absolute
02341          * timestamp or a "seconds.usec ago") so the target can avoid doing
02342          * extra calls into the filesystem if that isn't necessary (e.g.
02343          * during mount that would help a bit).  Having relative timestamps
02344          * is not so great if request processing is slow, while absolute
02345          * timestamps are not ideal because they need time synchronization. */
02346         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, &RQF_OST_STATFS);
02347 
02348         class_import_put(imp);
02349 
02350         if (req == NULL)
02351                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02352 
02353         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_STATFS);
02354         if (rc) {
02355                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
02356                 RETURN(rc);
02357         }
02358         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
02359         req->rq_request_portal = OST_CREATE_PORTAL;
02360         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
02361 
02362         if (flags & OBD_STATFS_NODELAY) {
02363                 /* procfs requests not want stat in wait for avoid deadlock */
02364                 req->rq_no_resend = 1;
02365                 req->rq_no_delay = 1;
02366         }
02367 
02368         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
02369         if (rc)
02370                 GOTO(out, rc);
02371 
02372         msfs = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_OBD_STATFS);
02373         if (msfs == NULL) {
02374                 GOTO(out, rc = -EPROTO);
02375         }
02376 
02377         *osfs = *msfs;
02378 
02379         EXIT;
02380  out:
02381         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02382         return rc;
02383 }
02384 
02385 static int osc_iocontrol(unsigned int cmd, struct obd_export *exp, int len,
02386                          void *karg, void __user *uarg)
02387 {
02388         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
02389         struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
02390         int err = 0;
02391         ENTRY;
02392 
02393         if (!try_module_get(THIS_MODULE)) {
02394                 CERROR("%s: cannot get module '%s'\n", obd->obd_name,
02395                        module_name(THIS_MODULE));
02396                 return -EINVAL;
02397         }
02398         switch (cmd) {
02399         case OBD_IOC_CLIENT_RECOVER:
02400                 err = ptlrpc_recover_import(obd->u.cli.cl_import,
02401                                             data->ioc_inlbuf1, 0);
02402                 if (err > 0)
02403                         err = 0;
02404                 GOTO(out, err);
02405         case IOC_OSC_SET_ACTIVE:
02406                 err = ptlrpc_set_import_active(obd->u.cli.cl_import,
02407                                                data->ioc_offset);
02408                 GOTO(out, err);
02409         case OBD_IOC_PING_TARGET:
02410                 err = ptlrpc_obd_ping(obd);
02411                 GOTO(out, err);
02412         default:
02413                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "unrecognised ioctl %#x by %s\n",
02414                        cmd, current_comm());
02415                 GOTO(out, err = -ENOTTY);
02416         }
02417 out:
02418         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
02419         return err;
02420 }
02421 
02422 static int osc_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
02423                               u32 keylen, void *key,
02424                               u32 vallen, void *val,
02425                               struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
02426 {
02427         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
02428         struct obd_device     *obd = exp->exp_obd;
02429         struct obd_import     *imp = class_exp2cliimp(exp);
02430         char                  *tmp;
02431         int                    rc;
02432         ENTRY;
02433 
02434         OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_OSC_SHUTDOWN, 10);
02435 
02436         if (KEY_IS(KEY_CHECKSUM)) {
02437                 if (vallen != sizeof(int))
02438                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
02439                 exp->exp_obd->u.cli.cl_checksum = (*(int *)val) ? 1 : 0;
02440                 RETURN(0);
02441         }
02442 
02443         if (KEY_IS(KEY_SPTLRPC_CONF)) {
02444                 sptlrpc_conf_client_adapt(obd);
02445                 RETURN(0);
02446         }
02447 
02448         if (KEY_IS(KEY_FLUSH_CTX)) {
02449                 sptlrpc_import_flush_my_ctx(imp);
02450                 RETURN(0);
02451         }
02452 
02453         if (KEY_IS(KEY_CACHE_SET)) {
02454                 struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
02455 
02456                 LASSERT(cli->cl_cache == NULL); /* only once */
02457                 cli->cl_cache = (struct cl_client_cache *)val;
02458                 cl_cache_incref(cli->cl_cache);
02459                 cli->cl_lru_left = &cli->cl_cache->ccc_lru_left;
02460 
02461                 /* add this osc into entity list */
02462                 LASSERT(list_empty(&cli->cl_lru_osc));
02463                 spin_lock(&cli->cl_cache->ccc_lru_lock);
02464                 list_add(&cli->cl_lru_osc, &cli->cl_cache->ccc_lru);
02465                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_cache->ccc_lru_lock);
02466 
02467                 RETURN(0);
02468         }
02469 
02470         if (KEY_IS(KEY_CACHE_LRU_SHRINK)) {
02471                 struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
02472                 long nr = atomic_long_read(&cli->cl_lru_in_list) >> 1;
02473                 long target = *(long *)val;
02474 
02475                 nr = osc_lru_shrink(env, cli, min(nr, target), true);
02476                 *(long *)val -= nr;
02477                 RETURN(0);
02478         }
02479 
02480         if (!set && !KEY_IS(KEY_GRANT_SHRINK))
02481                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
02482 
02483         /* We pass all other commands directly to OST. Since nobody calls osc
02484            methods directly and everybody is supposed to go through LOV, we
02485            assume lov checked invalid values for us.
02486            The only recognised values so far are evict_by_nid and mds_conn.
02487            Even if something bad goes through, we'd get a -EINVAL from OST
02488            anyway. */
02489 
02490         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(imp, KEY_IS(KEY_GRANT_SHRINK) ?
02491                                                 &RQF_OST_SET_GRANT_INFO :
02492                                                 &RQF_OBD_SET_INFO);
02493         if (req == NULL)
02494                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02495 
02496         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_KEY,
02497                              RCL_CLIENT, keylen);
02498         if (!KEY_IS(KEY_GRANT_SHRINK))
02499                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_VAL,
02500                                      RCL_CLIENT, vallen);
02501         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OST_VERSION, OST_SET_INFO);
02502         if (rc) {
02503                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
02504                 RETURN(rc);
02505         }
02506 
02507         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SETINFO_KEY);
02508         memcpy(tmp, key, keylen);
02509         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, KEY_IS(KEY_GRANT_SHRINK) ?
02510                                                         &RMF_OST_BODY :
02511                                                         &RMF_SETINFO_VAL);
02512         memcpy(tmp, val, vallen);
02513 
02514         if (KEY_IS(KEY_GRANT_SHRINK)) {
02515                 struct osc_grant_args *aa;
02516                 struct obdo *oa;
02517 
02518                 CLASSERT(sizeof(*aa) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
02519                 aa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
02520                 OBDO_ALLOC(oa);
02521                 if (!oa) {
02522                         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
02523                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
02524                 }
02525                 *oa = ((struct ost_body *)val)->oa;
02526                 aa->aa_oa = oa;
02527                 req->rq_interpret_reply = osc_shrink_grant_interpret;
02528         }
02529 
02530         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
02531         if (!KEY_IS(KEY_GRANT_SHRINK)) {
02532                 LASSERT(set != NULL);
02533                 ptlrpc_set_add_req(set, req);
02534                 ptlrpc_check_set(NULL, set);
02535         } else {
02536                 ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
02537         }
02538 
02539         RETURN(0);
02540 }
02541 
02542 static int osc_reconnect(const struct lu_env *env,
02543                          struct obd_export *exp, struct obd_device *obd,
02544                          struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
02545                          struct obd_connect_data *data,
02546                          void *localdata)
02547 {
02548         struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
02549 
02550         if (data != NULL && (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_GRANT)) {
02551                 long lost_grant;
02552                 long grant;
02553 
02554                 spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02555                 grant = cli->cl_avail_grant + cli->cl_reserved_grant;
02556                 if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM)
02557                         grant += cli->cl_dirty_grant;
02558                 else
02559                         grant += cli->cl_dirty_pages << PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT;
02560                 data->ocd_grant = grant ? : 2 * cli_brw_size(obd);
02561                 lost_grant = cli->cl_lost_grant;
02562                 cli->cl_lost_grant = 0;
02563                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02564 
02565                 CDEBUG(D_RPCTRACE, "ocd_connect_flags: "LPX64" ocd_version: %d"
02566                        " ocd_grant: %d, lost: %ld.\n", data->ocd_connect_flags,
02567                        data->ocd_version, data->ocd_grant, lost_grant);
02568         }
02569 
02570         RETURN(0);
02571 }
02572 
02573 static int osc_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
02574 {
02575         struct obd_device *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
02576         int rc;
02577 
02578         rc = client_disconnect_export(exp);
02596         if (obd->u.cli.cl_import == NULL)
02597                 osc_del_shrink_grant(&obd->u.cli);
02598         return rc;
02599 }
02600 
02601 static int osc_ldlm_resource_invalidate(struct cfs_hash *hs,
02602         struct cfs_hash_bd *bd, struct hlist_node *hnode, void *arg)
02603 {
02604         struct lu_env *env = arg;
02605         struct ldlm_resource *res = cfs_hash_object(hs, hnode);
02606         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
02607         struct osc_object *osc = NULL;
02608         ENTRY;
02609 
02610         lock_res(res);
02611         list_for_each_entry(lock, &res->lr_granted, l_res_link) {
02612                 if (lock->l_ast_data != NULL && osc == NULL) {
02613                         osc = lock->l_ast_data;
02614                         cl_object_get(osc2cl(osc));
02615                 }
02616 
02617                 /* clear LDLM_FL_CLEANED flag to make sure it will be canceled
02618                  * by the 2nd round of ldlm_namespace_clean() call in
02619                  * osc_import_event(). */
02620                 ldlm_clear_cleaned(lock);
02621         }
02622         unlock_res(res);
02623 
02624         if (osc != NULL) {
02625                 osc_object_invalidate(env, osc);
02626                 cl_object_put(env, osc2cl(osc));
02627         }
02628 
02629         RETURN(0);
02630 }
02631 
02632 static int osc_import_event(struct obd_device *obd,
02633                             struct obd_import *imp,
02634                             enum obd_import_event event)
02635 {
02636         struct client_obd *cli;
02637         int rc = 0;
02638 
02639         ENTRY;
02640         LASSERT(imp->imp_obd == obd);
02641 
02642         switch (event) {
02643         case IMP_EVENT_DISCON: {
02644                 cli = &obd->u.cli;
02645                 spin_lock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02646                 cli->cl_avail_grant = 0;
02647                 cli->cl_lost_grant = 0;
02648                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_loi_list_lock);
02649                 break;
02650         }
02651         case IMP_EVENT_INACTIVE: {
02652                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, obd, OBD_NOTIFY_INACTIVE, NULL);
02653                 break;
02654         }
02655         case IMP_EVENT_INVALIDATE: {
02656                 struct ldlm_namespace *ns = obd->obd_namespace;
02657                 struct lu_env         *env;
02658                 __u16                  refcheck;
02659 
02660                 ldlm_namespace_cleanup(ns, LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY);
02661 
02662                 env = cl_env_get(&refcheck);
02663                 if (!IS_ERR(env)) {
02664                         osc_io_unplug(env, &obd->u.cli, NULL);
02665 
02666                         cfs_hash_for_each_nolock(ns->ns_rs_hash,
02667                                                  osc_ldlm_resource_invalidate,
02668                                                  env, 0);
02669                         cl_env_put(env, &refcheck);
02670 
02671                         ldlm_namespace_cleanup(ns, LDLM_FL_LOCAL_ONLY);
02672                 } else
02673                         rc = PTR_ERR(env);
02674                 break;
02675         }
02676         case IMP_EVENT_ACTIVE: {
02677                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, obd, OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVE, NULL);
02678                 break;
02679         }
02680         case IMP_EVENT_OCD: {
02681                 struct obd_connect_data *ocd = &imp->imp_connect_data;
02682 
02683                 if (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_GRANT)
02684                         osc_init_grant(&obd->u.cli, ocd);
02685 
02686                 /* See bug 7198 */
02687                 if (ocd->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_REQPORTAL)
02688                         imp->imp_client->cli_request_portal =OST_REQUEST_PORTAL;
02689 
02690                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, obd, OBD_NOTIFY_OCD, NULL);
02691                 break;
02692         }
02693         case IMP_EVENT_DEACTIVATE: {
02694                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, obd, OBD_NOTIFY_DEACTIVATE, NULL);
02695                 break;
02696         }
02697         case IMP_EVENT_ACTIVATE: {
02698                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, obd, OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVATE, NULL);
02699                 break;
02700         }
02701         default:
02702                 CERROR("Unknown import event %d\n", event);
02703                 LBUG();
02704         }
02705         RETURN(rc);
02706 }
02707 
02715 static int osc_cancel_weight(struct ldlm_lock *lock)
02716 {
02717         /*
02718          * Cancel all unused and granted extent lock.
02719          */
02720         if (lock->l_resource->lr_type == LDLM_EXTENT &&
02721             lock->l_granted_mode == lock->l_req_mode &&
02722             osc_ldlm_weigh_ast(lock) == 0)
02723                 RETURN(1);
02724 
02725         RETURN(0);
02726 }
02727 
02728 static int brw_queue_work(const struct lu_env *env, void *data)
02729 {
02730         struct client_obd *cli = data;
02731 
02732         CDEBUG(D_CACHE, "Run writeback work for client obd %p.\n", cli);
02733 
02734         osc_io_unplug(env, cli, NULL);
02735         RETURN(0);
02736 }
02737 
02738 int osc_setup(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
02739 {
02740         struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
02741         struct obd_type   *type;
02742         void              *handler;
02743         int                rc;
02744         int                adding;
02745         int                added;
02746         int                req_count;
02747         ENTRY;
02748 
02749         rc = ptlrpcd_addref();
02750         if (rc)
02751                 RETURN(rc);
02752 
02753         rc = client_obd_setup(obd, lcfg);
02754         if (rc)
02755                 GOTO(out_ptlrpcd, rc);
02756 
02757         handler = ptlrpcd_alloc_work(cli->cl_import, brw_queue_work, cli);
02758         if (IS_ERR(handler))
02759                 GOTO(out_client_setup, rc = PTR_ERR(handler));
02760         cli->cl_writeback_work = handler;
02761 
02762         handler = ptlrpcd_alloc_work(cli->cl_import, lru_queue_work, cli);
02763         if (IS_ERR(handler))
02764                 GOTO(out_ptlrpcd_work, rc = PTR_ERR(handler));
02765         cli->cl_lru_work = handler;
02766 
02767         rc = osc_quota_setup(obd);
02768         if (rc)
02769                 GOTO(out_ptlrpcd_work, rc);
02770 
02771         cli->cl_grant_shrink_interval = GRANT_SHRINK_INTERVAL;
02772 
02773 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
02774         obd->obd_vars = lprocfs_osc_obd_vars;
02775 #endif
02776         /* If this is true then both client (osc) and server (osp) are on the
02777          * same node. The osp layer if loaded first will register the osc proc
02778          * directory. In that case this obd_device will be attached its proc
02779          * tree to type->typ_procsym instead of obd->obd_type->typ_procroot. */
02780         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_OSP_NAME);
02781         if (type && type->typ_procsym) {
02782                 obd->obd_proc_entry = lprocfs_register(obd->obd_name,
02783                                                        type->typ_procsym,
02784                                                        obd->obd_vars, obd);
02785                 if (IS_ERR(obd->obd_proc_entry)) {
02786                         rc = PTR_ERR(obd->obd_proc_entry);
02787                         CERROR("error %d setting up lprocfs for %s\n", rc,
02788                                obd->obd_name);
02789                         obd->obd_proc_entry = NULL;
02790                 }
02791         } else {
02792                 rc = lprocfs_obd_setup(obd);
02793         }
02794 
02795         /* If the basic OSC proc tree construction succeeded then
02796          * lets do the rest. */
02797         if (rc == 0) {
02798                 lproc_osc_attach_seqstat(obd);
02799                 sptlrpc_lprocfs_cliobd_attach(obd);
02800                 ptlrpc_lprocfs_register_obd(obd);
02801         }
02802 
02803         /*
02804          * We try to control the total number of requests with a upper limit
02805          * osc_reqpool_maxreqcount. There might be some race which will cause
02806          * over-limit allocation, but it is fine.
02807          */
02808         req_count = atomic_read(&osc_pool_req_count);
02809         if (req_count < osc_reqpool_maxreqcount) {
02810                 adding = cli->cl_max_rpcs_in_flight + 2;
02811                 if (req_count + adding > osc_reqpool_maxreqcount)
02812                         adding = osc_reqpool_maxreqcount - req_count;
02813 
02814                 added = ptlrpc_add_rqs_to_pool(osc_rq_pool, adding);
02815                 atomic_add(added, &osc_pool_req_count);
02816         }
02817 
02818         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&cli->cl_grant_shrink_list);
02819         ns_register_cancel(obd->obd_namespace, osc_cancel_weight);
02820 
02821         spin_lock(&osc_shrink_lock);
02822         list_add_tail(&cli->cl_shrink_list, &osc_shrink_list);
02823         spin_unlock(&osc_shrink_lock);
02824 
02825         RETURN(0);
02826 
02827 out_ptlrpcd_work:
02828         if (cli->cl_writeback_work != NULL) {
02829                 ptlrpcd_destroy_work(cli->cl_writeback_work);
02830                 cli->cl_writeback_work = NULL;
02831         }
02832         if (cli->cl_lru_work != NULL) {
02833                 ptlrpcd_destroy_work(cli->cl_lru_work);
02834                 cli->cl_lru_work = NULL;
02835         }
02836 out_client_setup:
02837         client_obd_cleanup(obd);
02838 out_ptlrpcd:
02839         ptlrpcd_decref();
02840         RETURN(rc);
02841 }
02842 
02843 static int osc_precleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
02844 {
02845         struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
02846         ENTRY;
02847 
02848         /* LU-464
02849          * for echo client, export may be on zombie list, wait for
02850          * zombie thread to cull it, because cli.cl_import will be
02851          * cleared in client_disconnect_export():
02852          *   class_export_destroy() -> obd_cleanup() ->
02853          *   echo_device_free() -> echo_client_cleanup() ->
02854          *   obd_disconnect() -> osc_disconnect() ->
02855          *   client_disconnect_export()
02856          */
02857         obd_zombie_barrier();
02858         if (cli->cl_writeback_work) {
02859                 ptlrpcd_destroy_work(cli->cl_writeback_work);
02860                 cli->cl_writeback_work = NULL;
02861         }
02862 
02863         if (cli->cl_lru_work) {
02864                 ptlrpcd_destroy_work(cli->cl_lru_work);
02865                 cli->cl_lru_work = NULL;
02866         }
02867 
02868         obd_cleanup_client_import(obd);
02869         ptlrpc_lprocfs_unregister_obd(obd);
02870         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(obd);
02871         RETURN(0);
02872 }
02873 
02874 int osc_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
02875 {
02876         struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
02877         int rc;
02878 
02879         ENTRY;
02880 
02881         spin_lock(&osc_shrink_lock);
02882         list_del(&cli->cl_shrink_list);
02883         spin_unlock(&osc_shrink_lock);
02884 
02885         /* lru cleanup */
02886         if (cli->cl_cache != NULL) {
02887                 LASSERT(atomic_read(&cli->cl_cache->ccc_users) > 0);
02888                 spin_lock(&cli->cl_cache->ccc_lru_lock);
02889                 list_del_init(&cli->cl_lru_osc);
02890                 spin_unlock(&cli->cl_cache->ccc_lru_lock);
02891                 cli->cl_lru_left = NULL;
02892                 cl_cache_decref(cli->cl_cache);
02893                 cli->cl_cache = NULL;
02894         }
02895 
02896         /* free memory of osc quota cache */
02897         osc_quota_cleanup(obd);
02898 
02899         rc = client_obd_cleanup(obd);
02900 
02901         ptlrpcd_decref();
02902         RETURN(rc);
02903 }
02904 
02905 int osc_process_config_base(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
02906 {
02907         int rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_OSC, obd->obd_vars, lcfg, obd);
02908         return rc > 0 ? 0: rc;
02909 }
02910 
02911 static int osc_process_config(struct obd_device *obd, size_t len, void *buf)
02912 {
02913         return osc_process_config_base(obd, buf);
02914 }

02916 static struct obd_ops osc_obd_ops = {
02917         .o_owner                = THIS_MODULE,
02918         .o_setup                = osc_setup,
02919         .o_precleanup           = osc_precleanup,
02920         .o_cleanup              = osc_cleanup,
02921         .o_add_conn             = client_import_add_conn,
02922         .o_del_conn             = client_import_del_conn,
02923         .o_connect              = client_connect_import,
02924         .o_reconnect            = osc_reconnect,
02925         .o_disconnect           = osc_disconnect,
02926         .o_statfs               = osc_statfs,
02927         .o_statfs_async         = osc_statfs_async,
02928         .o_create               = osc_create,
02929         .o_destroy              = osc_destroy,
02930         .o_getattr              = osc_getattr,
02931         .o_setattr              = osc_setattr,
02932         .o_iocontrol            = osc_iocontrol,
02933         .o_set_info_async       = osc_set_info_async,
02934         .o_import_event         = osc_import_event,
02935         .o_process_config       = osc_process_config,
02936         .o_quotactl             = osc_quotactl,
02937 };
02938 
02939 static struct shrinker *osc_cache_shrinker;
02940 struct list_head osc_shrink_list = LIST_HEAD_INIT(osc_shrink_list);
02941 DEFINE_SPINLOCK(osc_shrink_lock);
02942 
02943 #ifndef HAVE_SHRINKER_COUNT
02944 static int osc_cache_shrink(SHRINKER_ARGS(sc, nr_to_scan, gfp_mask))
02945 {
02946         struct shrink_control scv = {
02947                 .nr_to_scan = shrink_param(sc, nr_to_scan),
02948                 .gfp_mask   = shrink_param(sc, gfp_mask)
02949         };
02950 #if !defined(HAVE_SHRINKER_WANT_SHRINK_PTR) && !defined(HAVE_SHRINK_CONTROL)
02951         struct shrinker *shrinker = NULL;
02952 #endif
02953 
02954         (void)osc_cache_shrink_scan(shrinker, &scv);
02955 
02956         return osc_cache_shrink_count(shrinker, &scv);
02957 }
02958 #endif
02959 
02960 static int __init osc_init(void)
02961 {
02962         bool enable_proc = true;
02963         struct obd_type *type;
02964         unsigned int reqpool_size;
02965         unsigned int reqsize;
02966         int rc;
02967         DEF_SHRINKER_VAR(osc_shvar, osc_cache_shrink,
02968                          osc_cache_shrink_count, osc_cache_shrink_scan);
02969         ENTRY;
02970 
02971         /* print an address of _any_ initialized kernel symbol from this
02972          * module, to allow debugging with gdb that doesn't support data
02973          * symbols from modules.*/
02974         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Lustre OSC module (%p).\n", &osc_caches);
02975 
02976         rc = lu_kmem_init(osc_caches);
02977         if (rc)
02978                 RETURN(rc);
02979 
02980         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_OSP_NAME);
02981         if (type != NULL && type->typ_procsym != NULL)
02982                 enable_proc = false;
02983 
02984         rc = class_register_type(&osc_obd_ops, NULL, enable_proc, NULL,
02985                                  LUSTRE_OSC_NAME, &osc_device_type);
02986         if (rc)
02987                 GOTO(out_kmem, rc);
02988 
02989         osc_cache_shrinker = set_shrinker(DEFAULT_SEEKS, &osc_shvar);
02990 
02991         /* This is obviously too much memory, only prevent overflow here */
02992         if (osc_reqpool_mem_max >= 1 << 12 || osc_reqpool_mem_max == 0)
02993                 GOTO(out_type, rc = -EINVAL);
02994 
02995         reqpool_size = osc_reqpool_mem_max << 20;
02996 
02997         reqsize = 1;
02998         while (reqsize < OST_IO_MAXREQSIZE)
02999                 reqsize = reqsize << 1;
03000 
03001         /*
03002          * We don't enlarge the request count in OSC pool according to
03003          * cl_max_rpcs_in_flight. The allocation from the pool will only be
03004          * tried after normal allocation failed. So a small OSC pool won't
03005          * cause much performance degression in most of cases.
03006          */
03007         osc_reqpool_maxreqcount = reqpool_size / reqsize;
03008 
03009         atomic_set(&osc_pool_req_count, 0);
03010         osc_rq_pool = ptlrpc_init_rq_pool(0, OST_IO_MAXREQSIZE,
03011                                           ptlrpc_add_rqs_to_pool);
03012 
03013         if (osc_rq_pool != NULL)
03014                 GOTO(out, rc);
03015         rc = -ENOMEM;
03016 out_type:
03017         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_OSC_NAME);
03018 out_kmem:
03019         lu_kmem_fini(osc_caches);
03020 out:
03021         RETURN(rc);
03022 }
03023 
03024 static void __exit osc_exit(void)
03025 {
03026         remove_shrinker(osc_cache_shrinker);
03027         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_OSC_NAME);
03028         lu_kmem_fini(osc_caches);
03029         ptlrpc_free_rq_pool(osc_rq_pool);
03030 }
03031 
03032 MODULE_AUTHOR("OpenSFS, Inc. <http://www.lustre.org/>");
03033 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Lustre Object Storage Client (OSC)");
03034 MODULE_VERSION(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
03035 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
03036 
03037 module_init(osc_init);
03038 module_exit(osc_exit);
